loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 28 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Regina has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, where she sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Regina has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spare parts like oil, and will help Regina to generate greater profits and expand her business. Regina hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big business. 

Regina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Regina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like oil.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as visionary. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are regular ones. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy timber to make furniture. His business goal is to be the best within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima  is married and blessed with five children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Halima  cooks food for sale at the market and sells it to town dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants purchase to food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elika

texts.en:
Elika is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, cabbages and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are regular ones. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of onions and tomatoes. Her business goal is to be the best within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 46 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Lawrence has been working hard to manage his charcoal shop where he sells charcoal. 

To help expand his business, Lawrence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal, and will help Lawrence to generate greater profits. Lawrence hopes that in the future he will be able to develop his land. 

Lawrence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lawrence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Sophie has been working hard to manage her shoe shop, where she sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Sophie has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes, and will help Sophie to generate greater profits and buy a plot of land. Sophie hopes that in the future she will be able to build rentals. 

Sophie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sophie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 50 years old and lives in the town of Bungkho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Stephen has been working hard to manage his produce business where he sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Stephen to generate greater profits and add stock. Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to boost the business. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stephen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth, a 44 year old other mother of three, is settled for a living in Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she helps to work on their farm to make a living. 

She has been a member of Gata Daku MPC for two years and is now requesting a loan to purchase manure fertilizer and more seedlings for her vegetable garden. She is determined to have a better source of income and with her farm, it could be possible. 

In the future, she wants to have a well cultivated farm in order to have a good income for a better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer and more seedlings for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a male Kiva borrower. He has 5 children. He describes himself as visionary. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic windows, doors, gates and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are regular ones. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy paint to paint the items he makes. His business goal is to be the best within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy paint to paint the items he makes.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро жительница сельского района Гончи, который расположен в северной части страны. Ей 55 лет. Она честная трудолюбивая женщина. Зухро занимается растениеводством. Она имеет земельный участок, на котором выращивает люцерну, помидор и т.д. В этом дехканском хозяйстве, помимо нее работают муж, сын и невестка. Зухро решила сейчас начать еще один бизнес, чтобы принести в семью дополнительный источник дохода и увеличить бюджет семьи. Она планирует заняться животноводством, так как для этой деятельности у нее имеются все условия, то есть место для содержания скота и корм. Зухро берет кредит для купли скотин по причине не хватки собственных средств. Она надеется, что ее поддержат в реализации намеченных планов ради улучшения жизненных условий.
texts.en: Zuhro lives in Gonchi, a rural area located in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is 55 years old and an honest, hardworking woman. She has a plot of land where she grows alfalfa, tomatoes, etc. Her husband, son, and daughter-in-law help her around the farm. Zuhro has decided to earn additional income for her family by starting another business. She plans to raise livestock because she has all of the necessary conditions to keep animals, including feed and a place for the cattle. Zuhro is taking out a loan to buy cattle because she does not have the resources herself. She hopes for support as she tries to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle and start a new livestock business

loans.name: Asrou Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2007.Il est composé de membres qui habitent la même zone et ont pour activité générale l'exploitation agricole.

Célestine qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe.Elle est âgée de 35 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 03 enfants dont une fille.

Son activité est le commerce de poissons fumés et de poissons séchés.

Ainsi elle compte acheter du poisson fumé pour une valeur de 32000f,du poisson séché pour une valeur de 30000f et supporter des frais de transport pour 10000f.

le bénéfice lui servira de couverture de frais de scolarité de ses enfants,de leur santé et de leur nourriture.
texts.en:
This group was created in 2007. It is made up of members who live in the same area and whose main activity is farming.

Celestine, who is on the right in the photo with her arm raised, is the leader of the group. She is 35 years old and married with three children, two boys and a girl.

She sells smoked fish and dried fish.

She hopes to buy 32'000f worth of smoked fish, and 30'000f worth of dried fish and pay transport costs of 1000f.

The profits will enable her to cover school fees for her children as well as their food and medical costs.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila de 60 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace 20 años se levanta desde muy temprano a ganarse la vida con su venta de tortillas la cual realiza en su domicilio y es gracias a ello que apoya a su compañero de vida con los gastos del hogar. Domitila desea construir un baño y un servicio sanitario lavable con fosa séptica y además construir un cuarto en su vivienda, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, madera, clavos y lamina para realizar las mejoras en su vivienda.En el pasado recibió un crédito pero no pudo terminar las mejoras requeridas en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Domitila is sixty years old. She lives in her own house together with her life partner and family. She is a very hardworking woman. For the past twenty years, she has gotten up very early in order to take control of her life through her business selling tortillas. She runs this small business from her home, and it has allowed her to earn some money and to thereby help her life partner with some of the home expenses. 

Domitila wishes to construct a toilet and washroom with a septic tank. She would also like to add another room onto her home. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, wood, nails, and metal sheets so that she can make these improvements to her home.

Domitila received a loan for similar reasons in the past but was unable to complete all of the necessary improvements with those funds.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, wood, nails, and metal sheets to construct a better toilet and an additional room in her house.

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: Madame Aminatou exerce comme activité la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis quelques années dans un marché de la ville de Lomé. Elle a une grande clientèle composée de personnes de tout âge qui grandit chaque jour. Pour les satisfaire tous, elle doit gonfler son stock raison pour laquelle elle souhaite obtenir de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en: Mrs. Aminatou has been selling general food products for several years at a market in Lome. She has a large clientele made up of persons of all ages,  that is growing every day. To satisfy the demand she needs to increase her stock, which is why she requests a loan from Wages for purchasing various general food products.

loans.use: Purchase of general food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land where he will construct his home.

loans.name: Briyan Anderson

texts.es:
Briyan es un joven emprendedor, con muchos deseos de superación, trabaja en el área de ventas de una empresa de su ciudad natal, Lambayeque. Es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, su familia es su mayor motivación en la vida para salir adelante, por ello lucha día a día para brindarles mayor bienestar.
Briyan tiene pensado utilizar el crédito para comprarse una laptop y así avanzar con sus pendientes en la tranquilidad de su hogar. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, porque con esto estará mejorando su labor diaria y así podrá seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Briyan is an enterprising young man with a lot of desire to improve himself. He works in sales for a company in his native city of Lambayeque. He is a very responsible and hardworking person, and his family is his greatest motivation in life for doing well. He works hard every day to offer his family a greater quality of life.

Briyan would like to use the loan to purchase a laptop, which would permit him to continue working from his home. He is very thankful to the Kiva investors for their generosity; with their help, he will be able to improve his daily work and continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his work.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Âgée de 53ans, Amélé mariée à un transitaire vivent avec leurs 05 enfants à Lomé. Trois d'entre eux sont scolarisés.Afin d'aider son conjoint elle a démarré la vente de l"huile végétale , de coco et de palme au marché. Elle fait son troisième prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire ses clients. A l'avenir, Amélé désire devenir grossiste et aider ses enfants à s'épanouir.
texts.en: Amele is 53 years old and married to a transport agent. They live with their five children in Lome. Three of the children go to school. In order to assist her spouse, Amele started a business selling vegetable, coconut and palm oil at the market. This is her third loan for purchasing more merchandise in order to satisfy her customers. In the future, Amele would like to become a wholesaler and help her children to flourish.

loans.use: to buy vegetable, coconut and palm oil.

loans.name: Alex Omar

texts.es:
Alex es un joven emprendedor, soltero y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como empleado en una empresa de su ciudad natal, Ica. El buen desempeño que tiene en su trabajo es el resultado de todos los valores inculcados en él por sus padres. Cada día Alex despierta con mayor motivación de salir adelante por el bienestar de su familia.
Debido a los fuertes deseos que tiene de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Alex utilizará el crédito para comprar un artefacto como una cocina, con esto estará reemplazando la que tiene en estos momentos que está un poco deteriorada. Alex está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque esto ayudará con el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Alex is an enterprising, single young man with a lot of desire to move himself ahead in life. He works at a business in his native city of Ica. His good performance at work can be attributed to his upbringing, and all of the values that his parents instilled in him as a child. Every day, Alex wakes up with more motivation to work hard for the well-being of his family.

Due to his strong desire to improve his family's quality of life, Alex will use the loan to buy a home appliance, like a stove. He will be able to replace the stove his family is currently using, which is a bit damaged.

Alex is very thankful to the Kiva investors for their generosity; it will help him to improve the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy a stove for his house.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge  vive con sus padres y a su vez trabaja en una empresa de transporte y gracias a su trabajo el puede estudiar  y solventar sus estudios. El está estudiando la carrera de nutrición,  es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser un buen profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his parents and works at a transportation company. Thanks to his work, he is able to study and pay for school. Jorge is studying nutrition. He is a very responsible person and is very dedicated to his studies and to his family. He hopes to become a great professional and to continue studying and serving people.

Jorge is requesting this loan so that he can pay university fees and thereby continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es estudiante de la carrera de Enfermería, es soltera, sus padres trabajan y hermanos estudian, viene de una familia muy unida.
Al culminar sus estudios se ve trabajando en un Hospital Nacional, donde podrá ayudar a muchas personas que necesiten atención en su salud.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a student studying nursing. She is single. Her parents work and her siblings all study; she comes from a very united family. Once she completes her studies, she will be working at the National Hospital where she will be able to help many people that require medical attention. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería para poder ayudar a las demás personas, y también para poder dar un buen futuro a sus hijos. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar sus clases y cuotas, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Este préstamo que solicita hoy es para poder Pagar nuevamente sus cuotas de la universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ramona is studying nursing so that she can help people and so that she can also offer a better future to her children. She says that with the help of her previous loan, she was able to cover the costs for some of her classes and university fees, which was a huge help.

She is requesting this loan so that she can pay new university fees. In doing this, she will be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries and other items

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 34 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Getrude has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, posho (cornmeal), beans, sugar, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy rice, posho, beans, sugar, and cooking oil, and will help Getrude to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Getrude hopes that in the future she will be able to boost the business further. 

Getrude is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Getrude who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy rice, posho (cornmeal), beans, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Papa de 03 enfants de 15, 12 et 10ans, Kossivi est revendeur de matelas et chaises plastiques dans une boutique louée à cet effet. Il se fait aidé par 01 personne et sollicite un second crédit pour acheter des matelas et chaises. Le gain lui permettra d'ouvrir une autre boutique et suivre l'éducation de ses enfants. Âgé de 38ans, Kossivi a une ancienneté de 06ans dans l'activité.
texts.en: Kossivi has three children of 15, 12 and 10 years old. He sells mattresses and plastic chairs in a shop that he rents for this purpose. He has one person working for him and requests a second loan for buying mattresses and chairs. The profit will enable him to open another shop and cope with education costs for his children. Kossivi is 38 years old and has been working in this business for six years.

loans.use: to buy chairs and mattresses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic location. 

Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will do large-scale farming. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Judy's business is located in a fertile place and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will do large-scale farming. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, ella esta estudiando un post-grado en tributos, ya que a través de ello podrá incrementar sus conocimientos para salir adelante y ser una mejor profesional cada día. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder pagar las cuotas de su curso, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Maria is a very fighting and hardworking woman. She is studying tax at the post-graduate level. In taking these classes, she will be able to enhance her knowledge, move herself ahead, and become a better professional. She says that the previous loan was utilized to pay for her course classes, which was very helpful.

Today she is asking for a new loan to pay postgraduate fees. In doing this, she will be able to continue with her studies. She is thankful for this new opportunity to receive a loan and thinks that it will be a huge help.

loans.use: to pay postgraduate fees.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past nine years, Mable has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, water, cooking oil, sodas, beer, and tea leaves. 

To help expand her business, Mable has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, soap, water, cooking oil, sodas, beer, and tea leaves and will help Mable to generate greater profits and increase capital. Mable hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Mable is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mable who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy sugar, soap, water, cooking oil, sodas, beer, and tea leaves

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 31ans, Adjo a 02 enfants de 07 et 01an en charge. Seul l'ainé est scolarisé. Elle a démarré en 2008 la vente des charbons de bois à domicile. Le gain tiré de cette vente l'aide à prendre en charge ses progénitures. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et cet argent lui servira de s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Adjo souhaite assurer le bien - être de la famille et passer plus de commande.
texts.en: Adjo is a young woman of 31. She has two dependent children of seven and one year old. Only the older child goes to school. In 2008 she started a business selling charcoal from home. The profits from this business enable her to cover expenses for her children. This is her second loan from Wages and this loan will help her to stock up on merchandise in order to satisfy the demand of her customers. Adjo would like to insure the well-being of her family and make more orders.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Lilianne

texts.en:
Lilianne is a widowed woman. She has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she offers printing, photocopying, and scanning services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a permanent place and her primary customers are students. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of more computers. 

She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stationery and repair the printer. Her business goal is to have a cyber café within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful and improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stationery and repair the printer.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Monicah's business is located in a fertile place and her primary customers are large-scale and small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will do large-scale farming. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe constitué des trois femmes a été crée depuis le 10 Janvier 2007. Il est composé de femmes qui habitent dans le village et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Son responsable madame Fatou est mariée et âgée de 50 avec dix enfants dont deux filles et huit garçons tous a sa charge. elle s'active dans le commerce des produits divers essentiellement composés de légumes. 
Avec son nouveau crédit elle se payer des sacs de légumes qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau du petit marché de son village.
les bénéfices réalisés lui ont permis de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et scolaires pour ses enfants qui vont à l'école.
texts.en:
This group, which is made up of three women, was created on the 10th of January 2007. It is made up of women who live in the same village and who became acquainted through good social and professional relationships.
The leader is Mrs. Fatou. She is aged 50 and married with ten dependent children, two girls and eight boys. She sells various products, but mainly vegetables.
With her new loan, she plans to purchase sacks of vegetables that she will sell retail at the little market in her village.
The profits that she makes, enable her to cover the costs of food and schooling for her children who attend school.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in order to manage a money making business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. 

For the past 20 years, James has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells bread, water, sodas, soap, sugar, rice, posho, groundnuts and blue band. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bread, water, sodas, soap, sugar, rice, posho, groundnuts, and blueband. It will help James to generate greater profits and earn more capital. James hopes that in the future he will be able to expand on the business. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy bread, water, sodas, soap, sugar, rice, posho, groundnuts and blueband.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson is a married man. He describes himself as business-oriented. 

He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, sweets and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a developing area. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, sweets and other items. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, sweets and other items.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es de la ciudad de Encarnación, trabaja en forma independiente en la compra venta de productos varios, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, donde está en el 2do. Año.
Su principal sueño es terminar sus estudios y tener un trabajo estable, donde no tenga que salir más a trabajar de manera ambulante.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de titulación de su carrera, lo cual implica mucho gasto y necesita cubrir.
texts.en:
Roberto is from the city of Encarnacion.  He works independently, selling a variety of products.  He is studying for a degree in business administration, and he is in the 2nd year of this program.

Roberto's main dream is to finish his education and get a stable job where he doesn't have to go out into the streets to sell anymore. He is requesting this loan to pay for the registration of his degree so that his degree can be finalized.  This costs a lot of money, and it is an expense that he needs to cover.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 38 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. 

For the past two years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her business, which sells local drinks. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet for brewing the drink, and it will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. 

Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to building herself a residential house. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more millet for brewing the drink.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 38 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

For the past two years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells bread, water, sodas, soap, sugar, rice, posho and groundnuts. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bread, water, sodas, soap, sugar, rice, posho and groundnuts, and it will help Mariam to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mariam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy bread, water, sodas, soap, sugar, rice, posho, groundnuts.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. 

For the past six years, Rose has been working hard to manage her carpentry business, which deals in timber sales. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber, and it will help Rose to generate greater profits and buy even more timber stock. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her standard of living. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 36 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Ben has been working hard to manage his business, which operates a grinding mill. 

To help expand his business, Ben has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce to grind, and it will help Ben to generate greater profits and expand the business. Ben hopes that in the future he will be able to increase stock. 

Ben is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ben who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce to grind.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as self-driven. 

He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to open other branches within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have a better life. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Jocknus

texts.en:
Jocknus is 38 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Jocknus has been working hard to manage his clinic business, which operates a clinic. 

To help expand his business, Jocknus has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine, and will help Jocknus to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Jocknus hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Jocknus is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Jocknus, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine.

loans.name: Siga's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis mai 2010.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le commerce,l'agriculture et l'élevage.

Oumy qui se trouve à l'extrême gauche de la photo,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 58 ans,,elle est veuve et mére de 04 enfants.

Son activité est l'élevage et la vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle a une longue expérience pour ces activités

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 02 moutons d'une valeur unitaire de 15000f et 15 kg d'arachide pour 3750f.

Avec le bénéfice,elle compte renforcer son épargne et participer aux dépenses de nourriture de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2010. It is made up of members who live in the same village and who work in the farming or livestock business.

Oumy, who is on the far left in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is 58 years old and a widow with four children.

Her activity is sheep farming and selling peanut paste. She has many years experience in these activities.

With her loan, she plans to buy two sheep worth 15000f each and 15 kg of peanuts for 3750f.

With the profits, she hopes to reinforce her savings and help to pay the food costs for her family.

loans.use: to buy two sheep and  15 kg of peanuts.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as optimistic. 

She operates a retail business where she sells electrical items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. She hopes that in the future, she will own land. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has two children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a farm, where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

She will use this loan of  40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. 

This is her fifth loan with the SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick has two children. He describes himself as focused. 

He operates a tailoring business, where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are locals. 

He will use this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more tailoring machines. His business goal is to excel within five years.

loans.use: buy more tailoring machines

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, vive con sus padres. Estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, es empleado de un hotel y está cursando el Segundo año   de la carrera de Licenciatura Contable. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de una notebook, que le permitirá poder hacer los trabajos que le son asignados en su universidad.
texts.en: Pedro is from the city of Curuguaty and lives with his parents. He works and studies at the same time. He is an employee at a hotel and is studying his second year as a Licensed Accountant. He is requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying a notebook (computer) which will permit him to complete his assignments given by the university.

loans.use: to buy a notebook.

loans.name: Louella

texts.en:
Louella, 56, lives in Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She was gifted with five children. 

Louella is the family's breadwinner. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field, planting vegetables and doing a variety of other agricultural activities.
 
In need of additional working capital, Louella decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos to buy farm and garden fertilizer and pay for the labour costs of cultivating the family's land.

Being a member in good standing with the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income and provide for her family's daily needs. Louella is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings or be guided properly in her finances. 

She hopes to own a motor vehicle someday to carry her harvested goods to buyers.

loans.use: to purchase garden and farm fertilizer and pay labour costs for land cultivation

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex está siguiendo la carrera de Administrador de Empresas, comenta que su sueño es graduarse y poder ejercer su profesion pra poder llegar a ser alguien en la vida.
Quiere abrirse camino y poder hacerse conocido en el ramo que eligió, y de esa manera poder ayudar a sus seres queridos con lo que obtenga de sus estudios.
Pide este prestamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Alex is pursuing a business administration career. He says his dream is to graduate and be able to practice his profession to become someone in life.

He wants to break through and become known in the field of his choice, and thus be able to help his loved ones with what he earns from his studies.

He's seeking this loan to be able to pay the fees for his degree so he can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está trabajando con sus padres en el negocio familiar, se ayudan los unos a los otros y por medio de esa ayuda es que ella ha podido estudiar.
La carrera que sigue es la de ciencias en la educación, y comenta que su meta es poder terminar sus estudios, ser una gran profesional y ayuda a las demás personas en la educación.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, que le permitirá poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Nancy is from the city of Paraguarí. She's working with her parents in the family business. They help one another and through that aid, she's been able to study.

The profession she's pursuing in science education. She says her goal is to be able to finish her studies and be a great professional and help other people in education.

She's asking for this loan to be able to invest it in paying her fees, which will allow her to continue her studies as she has done.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es:
Emilce está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad, vive con sus padres quienes son los encargados de los gastos de sus estudios y son quienes la apoyan en todo.
Su meta es llegar a ser una profesional independizarse y trabajar ejerciendo su profesión como contadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula, y de esa forma seguir luchando y estudiando para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Emilce is studying Accounting. She lives with her parents who are responsible for the expenses of her studies and who support her in every way. Her goal is to become an independent professional and work in her profession as an accountant. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her tuition and in this manner continue to strive and study to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene sueña con poder recibirse de enfermera, para que por medio de su profesional sea útil, no solo a si misma, sino también a la sociedad a través de sus conocimiento, comenta que se esta esforzando bastante y que el préstamo que retiro antes era para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo nuevamente en las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando y trabajando.
texts.en:
Marlene dreams to being able to graduate as a nurse so that she can be useful through her profession - not only to herself, but also to society through her knowledge. 

She says she's been striving a lot, and the loan she took out earlier was to be able to pay the fees for her career. She's seeking this loan to be able to invest again in the fees for her profession, and thus be able to continue striving and working.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es soltera, por el momento vive con sus padres en la Ciudad de Ybycuí. Comenta que se encarga de la despensa desde hace aproximadamente un año, ya que anteriormente era administrada por su hermana. Anteriormente Sonia ya había accedido a un préstamo con nuestra institución, para ese entonces el destino del préstamo fue para montar un negocio propio, puesto que ella es también peluquera. Luego viajó a la Argentina buscando mejor suerte y volvió ya que su hermana consiguió un trabajo y no podía atender más el negocio, debido a eso fue que le llamo a su hermana para que se hiciera cargo de la despensa, hoy la despensa es suya y se encarga de montarlo.
El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de  azúcar, arroz, fideo, aceite, entre otros para poder surtir su negocio. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia is single and for the moment lives with her parents in the city of Ybycuí. She comments that she has been in charge of the store for about one year. Before it was run by her sister.

Sonia has had on previous loan with this institution. She used this loan to start her own business since she is also a hairdresser. Then she traveled to Argentina looking for better luck but returned when her sister got a job and couldn't look after the store. Because of this she called her sister so that she could take over the store. Today the store is hers and she is in charge of running it.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sugar, rice, pasta, oil amongst others to stock the store. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, pasta, oil, amongst others.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is a 45-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family which consists of three children. 

Her husband has been running a restaurant for the last four years. He provides people with good service and fresh food meals. His restaurant is situated in the main market. Many shop keepers come to his restaurant to eat delicious food. He needs some crockery and fresh food items to develop his business. In this regard, Munawar made contact with Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for a loan. BRAC issued a loan to Munawar for the development of her husband's business. 

Munawar is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase crockery and fresh food items for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Sumber Rahayu Group

texts.en:
After six months of her previous  loan period, Ni Luh successfully sold her piglets with a satisfactory profit. The price of fattened pigs was very high in the last 3 months. The same as Ni Luh, most of the members of the Sumber Rahayu group earned a satisfactory result and they decided to continue with their loan until they can have their own capital. 

The group is receiving an increased loan size, each receiving 2,000,000 IDR. 

From her loan of 2,000,000 IDR, Ni Luh will purchase feed and make new cages for her pigs. Now she has 5 sows and many piglets are ready to be born. She will keep these piglets for 2 months and then sell them to the buyer. Because it’s nearly the holiday season, the price for pigs is increasing. But, she hopes the price for feed does not follow the price of pigs and also increase.

Ni Luh and the members of the Sumber Rahayu feels the benefits of having this loan. They can manage the pigs and also training for the pig breeder. They hope they can have capital of their own and they won’t need to take a loan again.

loans.use: to purchase feed and make new cages

loans.name: Morice

texts.en:
Morice is a married man. He has 7 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are regulars.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a dairy cow for dairy farming. His business goal is to be the best within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sharitah

texts.en:
Sharitah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Sharitah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, posho, beans, sugar and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Sharitah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy rice, posho, beans, sugar and cooking oil, and will help Sharitah to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. 

Sharitah hopes that in the future she will be able to construct rentals. 

Sharitah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sharitah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy rice, posho, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Oñondivepa, como su nombre lo indica este es un grupo donde se fomenta mucho el trabajo en equipo, donde una encuentra apoyo en la otra, teniendo como base la solidaridad. Son de una zona eminentemente rural, donde todas se dedican a actividades rurales.
Una de las integrantes de este comité es la señora  Candelaria,  es una señora muy trabajadora, ella junto con su familia cría una cantidad considerable de ganados, los faena y vende la carne en su propio local de carnicería, con el préstamo ella quiere poder surtir su carnicería con otras variedades de carnes de manera a poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank known as "Oñondivepa" is a group that as it's name indicates, strongly promotes working as a team, where one member finds support in another, solidarity being the founding principal. They are from a especially rural area, where everyone works in rural activities.

One of the members of the communal bank is Candelaria who is a hard working woman. She together with her family raise a considerable quantity of cattle. They butcher them and sell the meat in their own meat store. Using the loan she wants to stock her store with other varieties of meat. In this way she can keep on expanding her business.

loans.use: to stock her meat store with a variety of meats.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 35 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Wilson has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells beans, posho, peas, soya, bread, balls, and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Wilson has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more beans, posho, peas, soya, bread, balls, and cooking oil, and will help Wilson to generate greater profits and expand the business. Wilson hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another business. 

Wilson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: purchase more beans, posho, peas, soya, bread, balls, and cooking oil

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a married woman. She has 11 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with potential for growth and her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more livestock. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more livestock

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a salon and a barber shop where he offers beauty services. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are regulars. 

Nelson describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more stock of salon products. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. 

This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of salon products.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
In the year 2009, Merlyn learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives. As a farmer in Dumingag, Molave, Zamboanga del Norte, she tried her luck and took a loan to start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Merlyn feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation and maintenance. Merlyn wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation and maintenance.

loans.name: Binti Ai

texts.en:
Binti Ai is married with three children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past seven years, she has operated a business selling fruit and coconuts. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and lemons for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and lemons for resale

loans.name: Abdunuru

texts.en:
Abdunuru is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Abdunuru has been working hard to manage his electronics shop, which sells electronics. 

To help expand his business, Abdunuru has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy stock of refrigerators, and will help Abdunuru to generate greater profits and improve business. Abdunuru hopes that in the future he will be able to improve family welfare. 

Abdunuru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abdunuru who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy stock of refrigerators

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman and has been blessed with five children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over two years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase 3 bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Mama Diarra's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 28 mai 2009 et il est composé de deux femmes unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame  Mame Diarra la responsable est une femme mariée âgée de vingt ans et mère d'un garçon de neuf mois.
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de paniers traditionnels pré fabriqué et de tissus divers.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 500000 francs cfa elle va acheter des paniers tissés et des rouleaux de tissus divers qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau du marché de sa localité . 
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois et de renforcer son capital financier.
texts.en:
This group was founded on 28th May 2009.  It is made up of two women who are united by strong social and business bonds.

Mama Diarra is the group representative.  She is 20 years old, married and has a nine month old baby boy.  She works selling traditional baskets and various fabrics.  She plans to use her loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy woven baskets and rolls of fabric, which she will sell at the market and in her local area.

Mama Diarra will use her profits to increase her savings level at the 'Banc Villageois', and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy baskets and fabric for resale.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Enock has been working hard to manage his shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Enock has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts like tyres, oil, glue, and brake pads, and will help Enock to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. 

Enock hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his business. 

Enock is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Enock who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts like tyres, oil, glue, and brake pads.

loans.name: Peregia

texts.en:
Peregia is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2  are currently in school. For the past 2 years, Peregia has been working hard to manage her business, in which she operates a bar. 

To help expand her business, Peregia has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beer, sodas, water, spirits, and will help Peregia generate greater profits and improve stock. She hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the business. 

Peregia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peregia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy beer, sodas, water, spirits

loans.name: Madjiguéne's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même village,elles ont comme activité l'agriculture et le commerce de légumes.

Sokhna qui se trouve à droite de la photo en position debout et levant le bras,est l'emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 50 ans et mariée et mére de 07 enfants.

Son activité est l'agriculture,elle cultive du mil,du maïs,de l'arachide ,aussi elle vend des légumes.

Avec,le crédit,elle compte acheter de l'arachide pour une valeur de 50000f,du mil pour une valeur de 50000f,du maÏs pour 50000f et le reste des légumes.

Son objectif d'augmenter son épargne,aider son fils aîné qui est tailleur en lui octroyant une machine à coudre.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011.  It is made up of members who all come from the same village and work in agriculture and selling vegetables.

Sokhna (standing on the right with her hand raised, in the photo) is the group representative.  She is 50 years old, married and has seven children.  She works in agriculture, growing millet, maize and peanuts.  She also sells vegetables.

Sokhna plans to use her loan to buy 50,000 francs CFA of peanuts, 50,000 francs CFA of millet, 50,000 francs CFA of maize and the rest will be spent on vegetables.  Her aim is to increase her savings and help her eldest son, who is a tailor, by buying him a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, millet and maize for her agriculture business, and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Diouma's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis mai 2010.Il regroupe en son sein des membres qui habitent le même quartier et s'unissent par des liens de solidarité.

Colette qui se trouve en position debout,à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 36 ans,est mariée et mére de 03 enfants  ,elle a comme activité le commerce de porcs.

Elle pratique l'élevage de porcs depuis plusieurs années et dispose d'un réseau de clients qui lui sont fidéles.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 05 porcelets à 20000f l'unité et la femelle à 25000f.

Son objectif est d'assurer les besoins familiaux,contribuer au financement de la scolarité et de la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2010.  Its members all live in the same district and work to support one another.

Colette (standing on the far right with her hand raised, in the photo) is the group representative.  She is 36 years old, married and mother to three children.  She has been raising pigs for a living for several years, and has a good network of loyal customers.  

Colette plans to use her loan to buy 5 piglets for 20,000 francs CFA each, and a sow for 25,000 francs CFA.  Her aim is to provide for the needs of her family and contribute to the education and healthcare of her children.

loans.use: to buy 5 pigs.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, 48, lives in the town of Mityana in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Richard has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells beans, posho, peas, cooking oil, sodas, and water. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beans, posho, peas, cooking oil, sodas, and water. This inventory will help Richard to generate greater profits and purchase land. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy beans, posho, peas, cooking oil, sodas, and water.

loans.name: Idania Del Socorro

texts.es:
A las seis de la mañana, sale de una casa una camioneta roja llena de panes para vender en las pulperías de algunos barrios de Managua. Producto elaborado en el pequeño negocio de Idania, una mujer de 41 años de edad, quien desde hace 19 años incursionó como comerciante y elaboradora de pan. Todo inició cuando dejó de trabajar en un hotel e invirtió su liquidación en este negocio, donde al principio ella hacia la ruta en bicicleta, hasta que poco a poco fue creciendo hasta comprar la camioneta para vender y las herramientas para elaborar un pan de calidad.
Idania está casada y tiene dos hijos a cargo, uno tiene 17 años de edad y el otro 10 años. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su familia. A ella le gustaría dar a conocer su producto por toda la capital, sin embargo primero quiere generar más ingresos para conseguir lo necesario para cumplir su sueño. Para ello está solicitando un préstamo para comprar bolsas, harina, levadura, mantequilla, entre otros productos, para ofrecer el mejor pan de su barrio. En sus planes está ampliar la infraestructura del negocio, así como captar nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
At six in the morning, a red truck full of bread leaves a house to sell to grocery stores in neighborhoods in Managua.  The bread is made in Idania's small business.  Isania is a 41 year old woman who 19 years ago established herself as a businesswoman and bread baker.  It all started when she left her job working in a hotel, and invested her money in her business.  She first made her routes on a bicycle until she started to grow and was able to buy a truck to sell her bread from and the tools needed to make quality bread.

Idania is married and has two children under her care.  One of her children is 17 years old, and the other is 10 years old.  Fortunately, she counts on her family's unconditional support.  She would like to make her bread known throughout the entire capital city, but first, she would like to generate enough earnings to make her dream a reality.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to purchase bags, flour, yeast, butter and other products so that she can offer the best bread in the neighborhood.  Among her plans are to improve the infrastructure of her business and attract new customers.

loans.use: purchase bags, flour, yeast, butter and other products .

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda es viuda desde hace 5 años y tiene dos hijos, ella vive en Viacha en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es propia, la casa tiene luz, agua y alcantarillado Nilda vende comida y entre las condiciones duras de trabajo esta la humedad tipica de las viviendas en el area rural, Nilda quiere un prestamo para comprar insumos como carne, verdura, papa, etc.  Nilda es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y esta ansiosa por expandir su negocio
texts.en: Nilda has been widowed for five years, and has two children.  She lives in Viacha in a brick and cement house that she owns.  The house has electricity, water and sewage.  Nilda sells food.  Among the difficult working conditions is the typical humidity in rural homes.  Nilda is seeking a loan to purchase supplies such as meat, vegetables, potatoes, etc.  In their home, Nilda is the sole provider, but they enjoy good health and she is eager to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as meat, vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Eliza has been working hard to manage her business selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Eliza has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Eliza to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Eliza hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the business. 

Eliza is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eliza who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

Kibibi operates an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en: Sokunthea is a 33-year-old motorcycle taxi driver and a married woman with two children living in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has been a motorcycle taxi driver since 2005. Both of her children are students. Her husband is a 34-year-old driver. Together, they can earn approximately $12 a day. Now Sokunthea would like to request a loan to buy a cow to breed for calves to resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to build a new house and help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a cow to breed for calves to resell.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Eduardo tiene 48 años, está casado con la Sra. Rosa, forman una pareja muy trabajadora, que lucha para poder dar a su familia una vida digna.
Tiene una ferretería en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su ferretería, de manera a poder seguir luchando por crecer.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 48 years old and is married to Rosa, they make a hardworking couple, that fights to be able to give their family a worthy life. 
He has a hardware store in which he works every day from the early hours of the day, fighting to better his conditions of life. He requests this loan to buy various materials for the hardware store, to be able to continue fighting to grow.

loans.use: to buy various materials to supply his hardware store.

loans.name: Inti Amaru

texts.es:
Desde pequeño Inti dibujaba por todos lados y creaba juguetes con cualquier objeto que encontraba. Su imaginación explotaba cada segundo y fue donde se dio cuenta que su profesión sería la de un diseñador. Ahora a sus 19 años de edad, cursa el primer año de Ingeniería en diseño gráfico, un paso más para convertirse en lo que siempre ha soñado. Él cuenta con el apoyo moral de su madre y el apoyo económico de su padre, quien es médico general.
Inti solicita un crédito para comprar un celular con una cámara que le permita tomar muy buenas fotos de los edificios. También para comprar una computadora portátil que le permitirá crear los diseños de sus proyectos, abriendo paso a su crecimiento profesional. Su meta es culminar su carrera con honores, para que en un futuro pueda optar por un trabajo donde pueda mostrar sus capacidades de un diseñador de calidad.
texts.en:
Since he was young, Inti drew everywhere and created toys with whatever objects he found.  His imagination was running all the time and he realized that his career would be that of a designer.  Now, at 19 years old, he is in his first year of Engineering studies in graphic design.  This brings him a step closer to becoming what he has always dreamed of.

He counts on his mother's moral support, and financial support from his father, who is a family doctor.  Inti is requesting a loan to buy a cell phone with a camera that will allow him to take very good photos of buildings.  The loan is also to buy a laptop computer that will permit him to create designs for his projects, giving him space for professional growth.

His goal is to finish his studies with honors, so that in the future he can choose a job where he can show his abilities as a quality designer.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop and a cell phone for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a large assortment of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 51 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, 4 of them are currently in school. For the past 15 years, Paul has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential goods like sugar, salt and water. 

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items like sugar, rice and all types of flour. This loan will help him generate greater profits and pay medical bills and school fees for the family. Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to expand it into a wholesale shop. 

Paul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Paul who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, rice and all types of flour

loans.name: Frank David

texts.es:
Frank, un joven de 2 años, vive en el municipio de Medellín, una pequeña ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Este joven de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de iniciar con un negocio de venta de licores, tiene alquilado un pequeño local donde montara su empresa.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Frank podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que pagara sus estudios y aportara a los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de surtido de licores de diferentes marcas y un equipo de sonido para emprender su negocio.

Colabora a un joven emprendedor, de mente creativa y grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Frank is a 20-year-old young man who lives in the Medellín municipality, a small town where it is difficult to find opportunities to make a living and business competition is quite stiff.

This young man has a proactive spirit and determination to succeed. His project is to start a liquor store. He has rented a small shop in which to set up his business.

With the help of a loan, Frank will be able to realize his dream of being independent and able to generate his own income. With his earnings he will pay for his studies and contribute to the expenses of his household.

The money will be used to buy an assortment of spirits of different brands and a sound system to start his business. 

This is a chance to collaborate with an enterprising young man who has a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: to buy an assortment of spirits of different brands and a sound system to start his business.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves es soltera pero tiene dos hijos, ella y su familia viven en El alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento propia que no tiene problemas Nieves es artesana y tejedora de mantas y quiere un prestamo para compra de insumos para su negocio como hilos y lanas de diferentes colores, aunque uno se sus hijos trabaja como chofer la familia tiene muchos gastos para mantener un nivel de vida decente por eso Nieves necesita su ayuda
texts.en: NIeves is single but has two children.  Her and her family live in El Alto in a brick and cement house that they own and does not have any problems.  Nieves is an artisan and a blanket weaver.  She is seeking a loan to purchase supplies for her business such as thread and different colored wool.  Although one of her sons works as a chauffeur, the family has many expenses in order to maintain a decent lifestyle, which is why Nieves is in need of your help.

loans.use: purchase thread and wool.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Apollo has been working hard to manage his business, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Apollo has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts like tyres, oil, glue,brake pads, and will help Apollo to generate greater profits and improve standards of living. Apollo hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his stock. 

Apollo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Apollo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more spare parts like tyres, oil, glue, and brake pads.

loans.name: Iris Agustina

texts.es:
La socia Iris Agustina pertenece al banco comunal BUENA ESPERANZA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 51 años de edad es separada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de productos de  belleza, la socia vende su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solicitan como crema, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partner Iris Agustina belongs to the Buena Esperanza community bank, which is located in the Cusco district and Cusco department. The partner is 51 years old, is separated and has 3 children. The partner alternates her daily activities with a business selling beauty products. The partner sells her merchandise to her customers, who request cream, perfumes and cologne, among others. The partner has been working in her business for a good time, and she does well thanks to her effort that she puts in every day. The partner wishes to continue working, and in this manner, to keep supporting her family.

The partner requests the loan for the purchase of perfumes. The partner is grateful for the given loan and promises to pay the established dues.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Flavia has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Flavia has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Flavia to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Flavia hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the business. 

Flavia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Flavia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Yola

texts.es: Yola esta casada desde hace 15 años y tiene dos hijos, ella es de la comunidad de PAMPA Belen y vive en una casa de adobe que es propia, el domicilio solo tiene luz y agua Yola es vendedora y productora de leche y necesita un prestamo para la compra de una vaca lechera, su esposo la ayuda trabajando como albañil en La Paz pero lo que ambos ganan no alcanza por eso Yola quiere su ayuda, ella goza de buena salud y es muy trabajadora
texts.en:
Yola has been married for 15 years and has two children.  She is from the community of Pampa Belen and lives in an adobe brick house that she owns.  The home only has light and water.
