The loan will be used to buy more poultry feed to offer for sale, and it will help Sheillah to generate greater profits in order to better cater to her family's basic needs. Sheillah's hope for the future is that she will be able to become a big poultry supplier in town. 

Sheillah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sheillah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed to offer for sale

loans.name: Jose Leonidas

texts.es: Jose de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la venta de pan francés y pan dulce, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar pan francés y pan dulce por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así generar buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 34 and lives in his own house with his partner and their three children. He works selling French bread and sweet bread. He runs his business from his home and also sells as a travelling salesman in various communities.

Jose is asking for for a loan to be able to buy wholesale French bread and sweet bread to carry on selling and earn a good income in this way.

loans.use: to buy wholesale French bread and sweet bread.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 44 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children. For the past two years, Robina has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential goods like sugar, salt, and water. 

To help expand her business, Robina has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to  buy more varied items for the shop  and will help Robina to generate greater profits and take good care of her family's basic needs. Robina hopes that in the future she will be able to own a supermarket. 

Robina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to  buy more varied items for the shop

loans.name: Elizer

texts.en: Elizer, a 48-year-old father of one lives in Misamis Occidental with his wife. He runs a furniture shop in their village in order to augment their income. He is determined to save money for the future of his child, so he sells finished products in the community to realize his dream. He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC, which he joined recently, to purchase additional raw materials for his furniture shop. He hopes to gain more income to be used for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his furniture shop

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is a married woman. She has eight children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fresh water selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during the rainy season when the business is low. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for her business

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema prepares and sells food items in her community, selling from her home to her neighbors and passers-by. Her primary business challenge is seasonality. She has operated her business for over five years. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables. She and her husband have five children. They live in a house that has electricity but not piped water. 
 
Neema decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With her loan of Kshs 50,000, she wishes to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es:
Oscar de 20 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo de 11 meses.Oscar es bachiller su pareja trabaja en los oficios dometicos. Oscar es empleado, tiene 8 meses de estar trabajando en el mismo lugar a parte de eso recibe otros ingresos que son remesas que le envia su papá desde Estados Unidos. A su empleo se traslada en bus y esta como a 6 km de su casa y viaja todos los dias.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar puertas para su vivenda. De esta manera su casa quedara mas segura y estaran mas tranquilos esa es una gran necesidad satisfecha. 

Los sueños de él son convertirse en un jugador profesional, para poder darle buen ejemplo a su hijo y un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 20 years old. He is in a relationship and has an 11-month-old son. He graduated from high school. and his partner works at home. He is employed and has been working in the same place for the past 8 months. He also receives money that his father sends from the United States.

He gets to work, which is located about 6 km from his house, by bus. He goes to work every day. 

He requests a loan to purchase doors for his home. This way, his home will be more secure and they can be more calm if this need is met.

His dreams include becoming a professional soccer player and being a good example for his son. He hopes to provide a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase doors for his home.

loans.name: La Luz De Villasol Group

texts.es:
Pilar Barbara tiene 48 años de edad. Ella es socia del grupo "La Luz de Villasol" formado por seis socios, todos ellos comerciantes cuyo mayor interés es hacer crecer sus negocios.
Pilar Barbara desde hace diez años administra y es dueña de un negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, su negocio está ubicado en un mercado de mucha concurrencia lo que le permite tener mucha clientela y mayor movimiento de su mercadería. Es un negocio que le permite cubrir sus gastos personales y familiares que ahora ya no son muchos ya que recibe el apoyo de sus hijos, pero sin embargo ella sigue trabajando porque le gusta mantener su independencia económica además que desea mejorar los ambientes de su casa.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá exclusivamente en el negocio, comprará ropa para atender algunos pedidos y ropa para el cambio de estación ya que estamos ingresando a la primavera y debe ofrecer nuevos modelos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pilar Barbara is 48 years old.  She is a member of the communal banking association called "Light of Villasol" formed by six members.  All of the members are business people whose main interest is growing their businesses.  

Pilar Barbara has been the manager and owner of a clothing store for women, men and children.  Her business is located in a very busy market which allows her to have a large customer base and to move a lot of merchandise.  It is a business that allows her to cover her personal and family expenses, which right now are not high since she receives help from her children, but still she continues working because she likes to maintain her economic independence and she wants to make improvements to her home.  

The loan that she receives will be invested in the business.  She will buy clothing to address the requests of her customers and to update according to the season since spring is starting in Peru and she needs to offer new models to her customers.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai, age 21 and unmarried, is a college student engaged in the study of economics. He lives in the city of Nablus. His father earns a low wage as an employee in the public sector. Odai loves the field of economics and is eager to find a job in this area in the future, so that he can eventually help his family with their expenses.

Odai has requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. With this purchase, he will be able to read research and articles online, as well as to write reports and perform other schoolwork.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his college studies

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, age 28, runs a retail shop to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past 12 years. She lives with her husband and their child in the town of Tala.
 
She will be using this loan to purchase a stock of rice, sugar, maize flour, and detergents to offer for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya. Her future goal is to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice, sugar, maize flour, and detergents to offer for sale

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald es soltero, no tiene hijo y vive en la comunidad de Cachi Lipe en una casa de qadobe que es propia, la casa tiene luz y agua Ronald es productor de leche y veterinario y quiere un prestamo para compra de una vaca lechera Ronald no tiene a nadie que le ayude, es un hombre solo pero goza de buena salud y el hecho de tener dos actividades para mantenerse lo convierten en un sujeto de credito confiable
texts.en: Ronald is single, does not have children, and lives in the community Cachi Lipe in his own home made of adobe. The house has electricity and water. Ronald is a milk producer and a veterinarian. He requests this loan to buy a milk cow. Ronald does not have anyone who helps him; he is on his own. But enjoying good health and the fact that he has two jobs to sustain himself make him a good subject for reliable credit.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth of Plaridel is married with four children. Her husband works on their farm while Lilibeth runs a general store selling groceries and school supplies in their village. She has been in this business for over ten years and in addition to her husband’s income it helps her to provide for the basic needs of her family.  With her unwavering ambition to become successful, she doesn't feel tired of working before sunrise and late at night. She joined Gata Daku MPC and took a loan to purchase school supplies and additional grocery goods for her retail store. She plans to expand her business and hopes to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and additional grocery goods for her retail store.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia earns an income by preparing and selling food in her community. She offers such comestibles as beans and chapati (flatbread) to her neighbors and passers-by. She lives with her husband and their four children in a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
 
With her Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking fat, oil, sugar, and beans. 

She dreams of expanding her business so that she can earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking fat, oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi sells clothing to earn an income. She sells her wares door-to-door to her neighbors and passers-by. Her primary business challenge is the high cost of transportation. 

Hamisi lives with her husband and their three children in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transportation. All three of her children attend school.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of Kes 20,000. With her loan funds, she will purchase bales of clothes to offer for sale. 

She dreams of establishing and expanding a boutique business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La socia Claudia continua dedicándose  a ejercer su profesión como odontologa,la socia lleva años con dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia dese poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales para curar los dientes.
La socia se voltio al momento de tomarle la foto.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Claudia continues working as a dentist, a profession she has had for many years. Her work is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. She hopes to be able to continue doing this work and helping to support her family.

She requests this loan to purchase the materials she needs to treat teeth. Claudia turned when this photo was taken, but she is happy to be getting the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials used to treat teeth.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, age 38, runs a wholesale produce business to earn an income. She has been working hard to manage her business for the past seven years. She lives with her husband and their four children, all of whom are enrolled in school. The family resides in the town of Kasangati.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of rice to offer for sale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits, which will allow her to pay school fees for her children and continue to build a healthy life with her family. 

Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch of the same business. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to offer or sale

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred prepares and sells food to earn an income. She offers her comestibles at the market to town dwellers and passers-by. Her primary business challenges are price fluctuations. 

Winfred lives with her husband and their child in a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and her child's school fees.

Winfred decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business. With the Kshs 40,000 loan funds, she will purchase essential ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase essential ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kisasi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, she has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair dryers for the business, and will help Getrude to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business to include a wholesale shop. 

Getrude is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Getrude who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair dryers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in her yucca and rice crops so that she can use the income for her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, age 33, engages in horticultural farming on a half-acre piece of land to earn an income. He started this business in 2000 and the business has grown ever since. Today, in additional to horticulture, he keeps dairy animals for milk production. He also recently purchased a motorcycle to help with farm transportation. He also uses it to earn an additional income by offering transportation services to the people around him. 

Paul is seeking a KES 80,000 loan in order to purchase seeds for his farm. He grows vital staple crops in Kenya that offer a good source of protein. These seeds are mainly grown by women for subsistence and for the local market. Paul is seeking a loan so that he can grow them on a larger scale as cash crops. 

Most of the money that will be made from this investment will go toward loan repayment. The rest will help Paul to grow the business and meet his family obligations.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a couch and a stove for his home.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan, age 30, runs a retail shop to earn an income. He sells essential goods such as sugar, salt, and water. He has been working hard for the past four years to manage his business.

Ivan lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala east region of Uganda with his wife and their two children. 

To help expand his business, Ivan has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase items like sugar, salt, and water to offer for sale, and will help Ivan to generate greater profits. This will enable him to better provide for his family's basic needs. 

Ivan hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his capital and his overall income. 

Ivan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ivan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase items like sugar, salt, and water to offer for sale

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; la socia tiene 65 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias elaborando tejidos a pedido como chompas, chalinas entre otros, socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas, hilos entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "IMASUMAC I" communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province in the department of Cusco. The member's name is Luz Marina. She is 65 years old, has two children, and is single.

She alternates her daily activities between weaving orders for jackets, scarves, and other things. She has been working in this business for a good amount of time. It is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.

She hopes to be able to continue working so that she can support her family. She requests this loan to purchase wool, thread, and other things. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wool, thread, etc.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando de 37 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de panes con mortadelas, vende de forma ambulante por las colonias y mercados sus productos lo anda en un carreton  como muestra en la fotografía, Armando vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija,  el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de panes, mayonesa, curtido, mortadelas, etc. todo por mayor, ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Armando is 37 years old and has worked for many years making and selling bologna sandwiches. He sells these products on foot throughout the neighborhoods and markets. He transports his products in a cart shown in the photograph.

Armando lives in his own home with his wife and their daughter. He requests this loan to purchase bread, mayonnaise, cole slaw, bologna, etc. in bulk. This is his only source of income and he will be able to increase his income for his household.

loans.use: to purchase bread, mayonnaise, cole slaw, bologna, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en: Sreyneang is a 42-year-old professional cook and a married woman with five children. She lives in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has been a cook since 2013. One of her children is a garment factory worker, one is a motorcycle washer, and two are students. Together, they earn approximately 14 USD per day. Living without a toilet is a bit difficult so Sreyneang would like to request a loan to buy bricks, cement, and lumber to build a kitchen and a bathroom with a toilet. This loan will help her and her family live in better conditions. In the future, she is going to fill the soil around her house higher and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and lumber to build a kitchen and a bathroom with a toilet

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline operates a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for the past three years, offering her services at the market to town dwellers and passers-by. Her primary business challenge is seasonality.

She lives with her husband and their child, who attends school. The family lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

With her loan funds, Angeline intends to add  a stock of hair braids to her beauty salon business. She dreams of expanding her business in order to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of hair braids for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cow shed

loans.name: Francisco Alexander

texts.es:
Francisco de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado, está acompañado, su pareja trabaja oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo pequeñito que vive en casa. 

Francisco trabaja la agricultura, lo ha hecho por unos 15 años y lo aprendió de sus hermanos mayores y decidió dedicarse a este trabajo para tener granos básicos para su familia y para el alimento para su ganado, porque también trabaja con ganado bovino.

 La distancia está como a 2 km de su casa y viaja a pie o en carreta. Le apoya un hijo y su horario es de 6:00 am a 12:00 md en la agricultura y el resto del día con el ganado. 

El préstamo que esta soliictando, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes y herbicidas para su cultivo de maíz. El préstamo le mejorará porque tiene la oportunidad de comprar de una vez lo necesario para su cultivo y así tendrá la oportunidad de seguir trabajando y esto le dará buena calidad de vida. 

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda, para poder darle un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 38 years old. He studied until 6th grade and is in a relationship. His partner does the household chores and they have a young son who lives at home. Francisco has worked in agriculture for the past 15 years, which he learned from his older brothers. He decided to work in this area in order to grow staple crops for his family and food for his cattle, since he also works with cattle.

His fields are located 2 km from his home and he travels on foot or by cart. His son helps him, and he works with his crops from 6:00 a.m. until noon and spends the rest of the day with the cattle. 

He will use the loan that he has requested to purchase manure, fertilizer, and herbicides for his corn crops. The loan will allow him to improve himself because it will give him the opportunity to purchase the necessary items for his crops so that he can continue to work. This will give him a good quality of life.

His dream is to continue working to the best of his ability so that he can provide a good future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, and herbicides for his corn crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of mobile recharge cards to offer for sale to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Rafael Santos

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 62 años de edad, vive con su esposa, sus hijos ya son mayores y no viven con él pues han formado sus propios hogares.


Rafael se ha dedicado desde muy pequeño ala agricultura, lo aprendió de sus padres ya que en aquellos tiempos era su mayor fuente de ingresos.


Él solicita este crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprará los fertilizantes para aplicarlos al cultivo de maíz y pagará mano de obra.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando en la agricultura mientras Dios se lo permita.
texts.en:
Rafael is 62 and lives with with his wife. His children are now grown-up and don't live with him as they have set up their own homes. Rafael has worked in agriculture since he was very small. He learned it from his parents because in those times it was their major source of income.

He is asking for this loan to invest in agriculture. He intends to buy fertilisers to apply to his maize crop and pay for labourers. His dream is to continue working in agriculture so long as God allows him to do so.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture by purchasing fertilisers to treat his maize crops and by paying for labourers.

loans.name: Tula

texts.es:
La socia Tula pertenece al banco comunal BUENA ESPERANZA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 43 años de edad es separada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de snack, la socia vende gaseosas, tortas, hambuerguesas, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra gaseosas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Tula is a member of the BUENA ESPERANZA communal bank; the bank is located in Cusco district and Cusco department.

She is 43 years old, separated, and has 3 children. She divides her time between her daily chores and her snack business.  She sells soft drinks, cakes, and hamburgers. She has been working in her business for a good while, which is going well thanks to the dedication that she puts into her business each day. She wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

She asks for a loan to purchase soft drinks.

She is grateful for the loan that has been granted and promises to make the payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Miriam Matilde

texts.es: Mirian de 43 años de edad se dedica desde hace 11 años a la venta de tortillas su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tienen mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad con que los atiende, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal, y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian, 43 years old, has worked for the past 11 years selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home, she has many customers due to her good prices and the friendliness with which she serves them. She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. 

She asks for this loan to purchase corn in bulk and lime, and in this way be able to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk and lime.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: In the photo, the man is the borrower’s husband. Navy is a 34-year-old garment-factory worker and a married woman with a young child living in a village in Takeo Province of Cambodia. She has been a worker since 2009. Her child is a student at a primary school. Her husband is 32 and also a garment-factory worker. Together, they earn approximately $10 daily. Navy would like to request a loan to buy floor tiles and paint to build a house. This loan will help her and her family live in better conditions. In the future, she wants to have a small shop for clothes designing.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles and paint to build a house

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi sells fruits and green vegetables to earn an income. She constantly struggles to improve her grocery stall so that she can sell more goods and save more money toward building a more formal establishment.

She lives with her husband and their two children, both of whom attend school. They live in a house that has electricity and piped water.

Mwanamkasi is requesting a loan in order to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Machinjioni Group

texts.en:
Chemela, who is in his early fifties, sells second-hand clothing items to earn an income. He works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. He has been engaged in this business for two years.

Chemela and his wife have nine children, three of whom are grown and six of whom are still at school. 

This will be Chemela's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase his stock of second-hand clothes. He dreams eventually of owning a food shop.

Chemela will share this loan with his loan group, Machinjioni, which consists of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Meyber Evelyn

texts.es:
Meyber de 40 años de edad, estudio bachillerato, esta casada. Su pareja trabaja en una venta de repuestos como contador. Tiene dos hijos que viven en casa y están estudiando. 

Meyber trabaja la agricultura, lo ha hecho por más de 8 años y lo aprendió de su padre y decidió hacerlo para tener alimento para su familia y para el ganado porque también trabaja con ganado bovino, antes tenía una tiendita. La distancia está como a 3 km y viaja a pie, se involucra el esposo y los hijos en los días del fin de semana. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago de mano de obra para su cultivo de maíz. El préstamo le ayudará porque podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas de una vez y tenerlos para aplicarlos en el momento oportuno, en cuanto a la calidad de vida sera mejor por el hecho de tener granos básicos y además la rutina de trabajo le da mejor calidad de vida. 

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda, en cuanto a las actividades económicas y en cuanto a los hijos que estudien y se preparen academicamente para que puedan tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Meyber, 40 years old, completed secondary school and is married. Her spouse works as a bookkeeper in a business that sells spare parts. She has two children who live in the house and are students. 

Meyber works in agriculture, she has done so for over 8 years and learned it from her father. She decided to do it to have food for her family and the livestock because she also works with cattle.  Before, she had a small shop. The distance is about 3 km and she walks; her husband and children help out on the weekend. 

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase manure, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and to pay labor costs for her corn crop. The loan will help her because she will be able to purchase agricultural supplies all at once and have them to apply them at the right time. As for her quality of life, it will be better due to having basic grains, and in addition, the work routine gives her a better quality of life.

Her dreams are to continue working the best she can, in regards to her business, and in regards to her children, that they study and prepare themselves academically so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, and pay labor costs for her corn crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car to repair it and to work on it again to provide his family with the enough money.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su dos hijas, ella se dedica  a la venta de refrescos, agua y gaseosa en su casa de habitación, con lo que gana logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un curto pero con lo que gana no le alcanza por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena, ladrillos, laminas, polines, pintura, pago de mano de obra, etc. y asi construir el cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía para que ella su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Domitila, 59 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their two daughters. She works selling drinks, water and soft drinks, in her house. With what she earns, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She wants to improve her house, building a room, but what she earns is not enough, so she asks for a loan to purchase the necessary materials such as cement, sand, bricks, metal sheeting, rafter beams, paint, labor costs, etc., and in this way build a room in the place shown in the photo so that she and her family can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, metal sheeting, rafter beams, paint, pay labor costs, etc.

loans.name: Ghezlan Group

texts.en:
Ghezlan is a group that consists of seven hardworking women living in Sana'a city, Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 350,000 YER from AMB, and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

This is 58-year-old Nabila. She is a widow who has six children. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Many years ago, he passed away and Nabila assumed all the responsibility of her children. Nabila and her children live in miserable conditions. She works hard to provide them with the necessary needs. Nabila decided to establish her own simple business making and selling lahoh, a traditional bread. It is her only source of income. Her lahoh is famous for its delicious taste, and you can always buy hot, fresh lahoh from her small store. This is why she always has many customers.

Nabila wants to expand her business. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that, and most of what she earns goes for the expenses of the family. This business is the sole source of income for Nabila and her children. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase ingredients such as flour, tang, milk, and other things to make lahoh in large quantities to sell to local residents.

Nabila hopes to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make lahoh, a traditional bread.

loans.name: Jadier Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Jadier es un veterano de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de Santa Bárbara con su esposa y dos hijos.

El es un hombre muy trabajador y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la ventad mercancía variada como productos para el hogar. 

Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de mercancía que distribuye en su motocicleta. El ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante.

Manifiesta que es un negocio muy bueno y sencillo de realizar para su edad.
El solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento a la motocicleta que usa para trabajar. 

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jadier is a veteran of thousands of battles he has survived throughout his life. He lives in the municipality of Santa Bárbara with his wife and two children.

He is a very hard-working man and for some time he has worked selling various merchandise such as household products.

His business consists in buying and selling merchandise that he distributes on his motorcycle. He sells his products as street vendor. 

He says that it is a very good business and simple to do at his age.

He asks for a loan to do some maintenance on the motorcycle that he uses for his work.

The loan will give him the opportunity to improve his business and give a considerable boost to his work, allowing him to earn resources for his children's education.

loans.use: to do maintenance on the motorcycle that he uses for work.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE FATIMA II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; la socia tiene 41 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando para una entidad estatal, a la vez la socia se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores, socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes .
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the  “VIRGEN DE FATIMA II” communal bank; the bank is located in Calca district, which is part of Calca province, Cusco department. 

She is Elizabeth; she is 41 years old, has one child, and is single.  She splits her time between her daily chores and working for a government entity.  She also works raising small animals.  She has worked in this business for a good while, which is going will thanks to the dedication that she puts into her business every day. She wants to be able to continue working and, in this way, to be able to continue supporting her family.

She asks for the loan to purchase guinea pigs.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Biyinzika Women's Group

texts.en:
Justine, age 30, is a member of Biyinzika Women's group. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 9 months. Her older child goes to school. In addition, Justine looks after two children of her brother who is jobless.

She operates a retail business in Nansana Wakiso district. She started the business four years ago with the support of the husband who gave her starting capital. Her husband helped her because he realized that his income could not support the entire family's needs.

Justine approached UGAFODE Microfinance for a loan to restock her business in order to meet the growing needs of her customers and to enable her to favorably compete with other retail shops around her. She thanks UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for being supportive.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap, bread, corn flour, soda, and juice

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a 36-year-old married father of two, has been operating a barber shop for 10 years now. He will be using this loan to buy new shaving equipment such as shaving machines, hair brushes and hair oil. The anticipated profits will help improve both his business and the living standards of his family.

This is David's sixth loan from VisionFund Kenya, and he hopes to open more barber shops in the future.

loans.use: To buy new shaving equipment.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy is 32 years old and works in a garment factory. She is married and has one child, a student. She lives in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has been a worker since 2005. Her husband is 43 and a soldier. Both of them can earn approximately 10 USD daily. Now Chanthy would like to request a loan to buy clothes to resell in her free time from work. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she wants to run a clothing shop, build a bigger house, and support her child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol, who is single, has been raising cattle in the Philippines for two years now. She has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional cattle.

In the future, Carol would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle for her business

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
José es peluquero y además siembra granos básicos, en el trabajo de peluquero tiene 6 años de experiencia y lo aprendió con un amigo, y así decidió ofrecer sus servicios a otros. En el trabajo de agricultor ya tiene 15 años de experiencia y lo aprendió de sus padres que desde pequeño lo llevaban al campo. El lugar donde trabaja como jornalero le queda a 20 minutos de su casa, se transporta a pie y trabaja de  6 A.M a 12 M.D. 


Él necesita el crédito para terminar de cancelar un terreno que compró junto a su padre y para invertir en la siembra de granos básicos. El crédito le ayudará porque podrá terminar de pagar la deuda y para sacar adelante su cultivo.


Su sueño es mejorar la peluquería equipándola bien para brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes y que esta actividad cada día le sea más rentable.
texts.en: Jose is hairdresser and he also grows basic grains. He has 6 years of experience in his job as a hairdresser, which he learned from a friend in order to offer his service to others. He has already 15 years of experience working as a farmer. He learned this from his parents who used to take him to the fields since he was very young. The place where he works as a daily laborer is 20 minutes from his house. He walks there and works from 6 A.M to 12 noon. He needs the loan to finish up paying for a plot of land he bought with his father and to invest growing basic grains. This loan will help him to pay off his debt and to continue with his cultivation. His dream is to improve his hairdresser salon with the right equipment so that he can offer better service to his customers, and that this work is more profitable everyday.

loans.use: to finish paying off a plot of land he bought with his father and to invest growing basic grains.

loans.name: Gitangu High Breeders Self Help Group

texts.en: The person raising his hand in the photo is Nicholas, a member of Gitangu High Breeders Self Help Group.He is fifty two years old, married and blessed with five children who have completed school. He earns a living in dairy and poultry farming. He is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the training on enterprise management which has equipped him with skills that has enabled him manage his farming effectively through keeping proper farm records.However, Nicholas is constrained financially and needs money to expand his dairy farming by buying quality fodder for his dairy cows so that they can improve on their milk production. He hopes to generate more income to provide food in his household. He is grateful to Kiva for the financial support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his dairy cows

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four children - three sons and a daughter. He works as an employee in a local firm with a low income. 

Ramzi would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff but he doesn't have enough money. Ramzi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Ramzi will be able to provide clean water for his kids.
 
Ramzi appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana de 35 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos un varón de 16 años de edad y 2 niñas de 10 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer admirable que sabiendo que la responsabilidad de la crianza de sus hijos es solo suya, pone mucho empeño y demuestra amabilidad para realizar su venta de carne de res la cual le ha dado resultado porque cada día cuenta con más clientela que busca sus productos, la venta la realiza desde hace más de 10 años, y es gracias a ello que logra sostener la economía familiar. Ana desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de venta de carnes de res, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lomo de aguja, costilla, posta negra, puyazo y patas de res. Para que su venta sea mejor y poder ofrecerle mayor calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Ana, 35 years old, lives in her own house with her three children, a 16 year old boy, and two girls, ages 10 and 3. She is an admirable woman who, knowing that the responsibility for raising her children was solely hers, works very hard and is friendly when selling her beef cuts, which has had results because every day she has more customers looking for her products. She has had this business for over 10 years, and thanks to this, she manages to maintain the family economically. Ana wants to continue investing in her business selling beef cuts, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in to purchase chuck roast, ribs, topside rounds, tenderloin, and cow feet so her sales improve and to be able to offer her customers better quality.

loans.use: to purchase chuck roast, ribs, topside rounds, tenderloin, and cow feet.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, a 51-year-old married woman, has been making a living raising cattle in the Philippines for five years now. She earns additional income from a general store.

Having repaid her previous loan, Editha is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional cattle and vitamins for her enterprise. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle and vitamins.

loans.name: Victory Group

texts.en:
The Victory group is composed of three members. They have an average age of 36 years old. They all live in Chorkor, a district of Accra. They know each other through a local “susu” [neighborhood savings groups] and through their work. The group members work as vendors selling soft drinks and egg products. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to join ID-Ghana and are on their 14th loan cycle.

Benjamin (the man standing to the right in the photo) is a well-known soft drink vendor. He plans to use this loan to buy 20 boxes of different soft drinks. He stocks up in Accra and then resells the drinks for cash in Chorkor to a customer base composed of men and women. With this loan, Benjamin plans to earn a good monthly revenue, which will be used to provide for some minor needs of his, with the rest being invested in his business. Benjamin is really counting on this partnership with ID-Ghana in achieving his goal of expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy 20 boxes of different soft drinks

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
Clara tiene 40 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, nunca tuvo la oportunidad de ir a estudiar porque sus padres no la mandaron, actualmente vive sola ya que sus esposo falleció hace 6 años, tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad.

Ella tiene mucha experiencia en la venta de pescado, desde que estaba muy pequeña su madre la mandaba a vender casa por casa, hoy en día trabaja junto con uno de sus hijos, él sale a pescar desde muy temprano y Clara vende los pescados.

Clara necesita el crédito para comprar redes y arpones de pesca para que su negocio mejore.

Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y sabe que lo puede lograr si sus ingresos mejoran con la ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
Clara is 40 years old. She takes care of the household tasks and never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents didn't send her to school. Currently she lives alone because her husband died 6 years ago. She has two adult children.

She has a lot of experience selling fish; since she was very young, her mother sent her to sell house-to-house. Now she works with one of her children. He goes to fish early in the morning and Clara sells the fish.

Clara needs a loan to purchase nets and fishing harpoons so that her business improves.

Her dream is to improve her house and she knows that she can accomplish it if her income improves with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase nets and fishing harpoons so her business improves.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, where she does hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair relaxers and braids, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to start up another beauty salon. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair relaxers and braids for her salon.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Graciela; la socia tiene 62 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias elaborando tejidos a pedido como chompas, chalinas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas, hilos entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the “IMASUMAC I” communal bank; the bank is located in Cusco district, part of Cusco province and Cusco department.

She is Graciela, 62 years old, with three children and a widow. She divides her time between her daily chores and making knitted products to order such as sweaters and scarves among others. She is a responsible and enterprising person. She wants to be able to continue working and, in this way, continue supporting her family.

She asks for a loan to purchase wool and yarn among others.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase wool and yarn among others.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is 56 years old and is married with four children. Elpedia works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 18 years and also earns an income from fish vending and electronic mobile load retailing.

Elpedia has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soft-drinks, beers, candies, sanitary pads, detergent soap, etc. She has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Elpedia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, soft-drinks, beers, candies, sanitary pads, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Ningome

texts.en:
Ningome is married with three children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Ningome operates a food making business, making consumables like beans and chapatti (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing foodstuffs to be her major challenge. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Alfredo junto con su esposa desea comprar un negocio de heladería en un local ubicado en el municipio de Itagüí.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que les dio su hijo, esto es lo que los impulsa para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Aunque el siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar los derechos y propiedad de este negocio de venta de helados.

Con este crédito podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de un padre colombiano!
texts.en:
With the idea of getting ahead and improving himself, Alfred along with his wife, wants to purchase a ice cream shop in the municipality of Itagüí.

The idea came up due to motivation their son gave them. This is what pushed them to undertake this business and, in this way, generate the necessary income to sustain the household. Although he has always wanted to be independent, he never had the courage to risk himself to start a business; but now he feels he has the strength and ability to do it. 

He asks for a loan to purchase the license and property of this ice cream business. 

With this loan, he will be able to undertake this project and will be able to achieve his dream of being independent.

By supporting this loan, you will be giving a boost to the entrepreneurial ideas of a Colombian father!

loans.use: to purchase to the license and property for his ice cream business.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jinky is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jinky has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jinky requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Jinky has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jinky would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been running for 23 years now.

Emerenciana requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 31 years old and is married. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She does dairy farming and has been in this business for nine years.

She will use this loan to buy another dairy cow and be able to get more milk for supply. She will use the anticipated profits to pay for her children's school fees.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to be a successful dairy farmer, educate all her children and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en:
Ma. Nida is 54 years old and is married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Nida has a food vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 34 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Ma. Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad is a 19-year-old ambitious young man living with his five family members. His aim is to find a job with a good income. 

Muhannad is now a university student majoring in English Language, and he is in his second year. He is requesting a loan to pay for his upcoming tuition fees, so that he will be able to reach his aim that will give him the chance to support his family.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming tuition fees.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is a married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlina is 47 years old.

Merlina has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her business.

Merlina has been in this business for 14 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a single mother of five children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zawadi has operated a retail business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbours. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. Zawadi dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and coking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and coking fat oil.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is 69 years old, widowed, and has two children. Modesta works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell in her general store.

Modesta has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, juice, soft drinks, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Modesta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gitangu High Breeders Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Teresia who is fifty five years old. She is member of Gitangu High Breeders Self Help Group located in Limuru, Kenya. She is married and a mother of four children.She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from trainings on enterprise and financial management.
She farms vegetable such as tomatoes, onions, kale and cabbages. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva in order to boost her farming by buying high quality planting seeds. This will improve her crop yield and more supply to the market. She hopes this will go a long way in supporting education for her children.
Teresiah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy planting seeds.

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
Zef has decided to switch his activity from poultry (turkeys) that he has been running for some time to livestock (goats). 

He has a contract with a famous restaurant "Mrizi i Zanave" operating from a farm in northern rural Albania, to sell them the goat's dairy products and baby goats. To achieve this, he needs your financial help to buy eight goats of a good breed. He is certain that this new activity will be much more profitable for him.
 
Kindly note that Zef has been photographed next to his cow, since he doesn't have the goats yet.

loans.use: to buy eight goats of a good breed for his new venture.

loans.name: In God Sorlimor Group

texts.en:
The members of the 'In God Sorlimor' group are married women who are, on average, 27 years old and have three children. They all live in the same area. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution ID-Ghana in order to better the conditions of their businesses. They are on their fifth loan and intend to repay it promptly. They are into kenkey (cooked corn dough) and fish, gizzards and fruits.

Margaret is 27 years old, married and has two children. She plans to buy corn dough, firewood, and fish to cook and sell to customers. She sells her products daily for cash in her area to a mixed group of customers. 

Margaret hopes to earn a good monthly profit which will be used to pay back [her part of] the loan and to also help her husband with the daily expenses.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy corn dough, firewood, and fish, to cook and sell to customers.

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is a 23 year old, independent, young man living with his family. He always thought of depending on himself by finding a job with a good income. 

Anas is now a university student majoring in Psychological Guidance, and he is in his second year. He is requesting a loan to be able to pay for his upcoming tuition fees to be able to reach his aim.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming tuition fees

loans.name: Majani Mapana Group

texts.en:
Asha is aged forty, single and has one school-aged daughter. She has been involved with two businesses; firstly, cloth selling and secondly, snacks (chapati and donuts), which she makes herself. 

Asha wakes up early in the morning, especially on school days, preparing her daughter for school. Then, from 07:00am she starts with business issues. She finishes with the business at 08:00pm and is able to realize a fair monthly profit. 

For the sake of improving her business and making life good, she needs to find a better way to replenish her business with enough stock. She is now at Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner, to get financial support. She has requested a loan to be apportioned among MAJANI MAPANA's nine members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Asha will invest this credit to buy stock for all her businesses. Her dreams is to be successful in business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Yoem is a 61-year-old widowed woman with no children. She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia with a niece and a nephew who is a blacksmith. 

Yoem makes clay pots and water containers. She has been in this work since 2000, and can earn approximately $2.50 daily. 

Now she would like to request a loan to buy a machine for her nephew to use in his work. This loan will help her nephew earn more income for the family. In the future, she is going to help to keep expanding her nephew’s enterprise and build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a machine for her nephew to use in his work.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Lilian operates a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Tuzamurane Cb Group

texts.en:
Tuzamuane is a group led by Miriam who is 24 years old. The group name means “support each other” in English. 

Miriam has been a group leader for two years. She sells clothes and has been selling in a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and dresses to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kisasi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past five years, Esther has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh bananas for sale, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and improve on her family’s standard of living. Esther hopes that in the future, she will be able to own more other businesses in town. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Esther who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh bananas for sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single young man from Rafah city. His mother works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. Mohammad is a student in a college where he studies nursing. He loves this field, and he would like to find a job in a hospital or health center. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to read research and articles online and write his reports. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Om Hazem Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Hazem. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB.

Fathia is the leader of the group. She is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is living with her family in Sana'a, Yemen. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family, and his income is very low and not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. 

Her children have very old clothes. The children feel sad and ashamed because of the clothes, and they want to have a good appearance. Fathia doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 10,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase new clothes for her children.

Fathia looks forward to providing her children with all things they need, and she hopes to send them to a private school.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for her children.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Dairy farming is an important source of income and employment for smallholder Kenyan farmers like Joseph. He is 54 years old. He is happily married to a 49-year-old wife. They have one child. He runs a 2-acre mixed farm in Rubate village located in the Central Province of Kenya. He keeps dairy cattle and grows tea, vegetables, and other crops on his farm. He also engages in other side businesses, such as his small café, for additional income.
 
Joseph has been doing this work for 15 years! He is constantly upgrading and introducing new ways and approaches of doing business to make his farm more sustainable to the environment while still being profitable. Joseph is seeking a loan to fully incorporate zero-grazing into his farm. The cattle management system on his farm is shifting from being extensive (which is confined in ranches and large-scale farms) to being intensive. The intensive systems are the most predominant and comprise zero-grazing and semi-zero grazing systems.

With your funding, the introduction of zero-grazing will create significant value for Joseph's business. This management system is the most suitable for this farmer, considering his land, labour, and capital.

Returns from this investment will be ploughed back into the business to drive its evolution into a modern practise. Your loan will elevate the quality of life for Joseph and his family.

loans.use: to start zero-grazing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to cover her daughter’s education expenses

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George has a retail shop and has been running it for four years. He is 29 years old and married to Jane; they have no children. He also supports two members of her family.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of household utensils, cereals, and detergents to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to have a wholesale shop and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is married and runs a livestock business in the Philippines. She has operated her business for five years and she works hard to support her family. 

Paulina is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with two children. For the past three years, Jane has been operating a retail shop and she also sells clothes. She supports three additional family members and her spouse also provides additional income.

Jane is requesting a loan to buy more stock of goods to sell including rice, sugar, and flour. She will also buy some clothing to sell. This will be her third loan from VisionFund Kenya. Jane will use the anticipated profits from her loan to provide for the needs of her family. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy retail goods and clothing to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old independent young man living with his five family members. He is now a university student majoring in sports science and he is in his first year. Mohammad also works in the evenings at a grocery store. 

Mohammad is requesting a loan to pay for his upcoming tuition fees. He will use his loan to accomplish his goal and give him the chance to support his family.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming tuition fees

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Rosa works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling charcoal in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from fruit vending. Rosa is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers for her business.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 45 years old.

Rowena has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rowena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 54 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is still in school. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, candies, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, candies, coffee, cereals, etc. 

Teresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, candies, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Abahuje Group

texts.en: Abahuje is a group led by Chantal who is 55 years old. The group name means “together” in English. Chantal has been a group leader for 6 years. She has a shop and has been selling products for 19 years. The group members sell different items and they have the same goal of changing their lives. With a portion of this loan, Chantal would like to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve the group's standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Srieng

texts.en:
Srieng is a 57-year-old widow with two children. She is a vegetable seller and she has been in this business for over 14 years.

To help his mother, Srieng's son runs a motorcycle taxi business and her daughter works as a garment-factory worker. All of them live in the Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. Due to the fact that her son’s motorcycle is old, Srieng would like to request a loan to buy a newer motorcycle for her son to run as motorcycle taxi and also to transport her vegetables to sell at the market.

This loan will help her son earn more income for the family and reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she is going to expand her business, and build a bathroom and fences around her house.

loans.use: to buy a newer motorcycle for her son to use as a motorcycle taxi and to transport her vegetables

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера работает на центральном рынке города Белая Церковь. Она занимается торговлей женской обувью. В этом бизнесе она занята уже 21 год, опыт работы — громадный. У Веры — свое торговое место — она давно выкупила землю. 
Сумма в 40 000 гривен нужна Вере для того, чтобы сделать ремонт на балконе в квартире и утеплить его, чтобы было теплее зимой. Она планирует установить металлопластиковые окна, утеплить сам балкон, установить двери, сделать стяжку, заменить линолеум, сделать подсветку на балконе и повесить шкафчики. В связи с газовыми трудностями в Украине в стране ожидают проблем с отоплением в холодный сезон, в следствие чего многие люди стараются утеплить свои жилища всеми возможными способами, чтобы создать максимально комфортные условия для своих семей на зимний период.
texts.en: Vera works in the central market of Belaya Tserkov.  She sells women's shoes, and has done so for the past 21 years.  She has a lot of experience under her belt and has owned her own market stall for a long time as well.  Vera expects she might have trouble heating her apartment during the cold season due to the problems with gas negotiations in the Ukraine, which are causing many people to look for other ways to insulate their homes and make them comfortable for the winter.  As such, she is requesting a loan of 40,000 hryvnia to renovate the balcony in her apartment and insulate it.  Specifically, she plans on installing reinforced plastic windows, putting in doors, laying down a concrete foundation and new linoleum for the floor, adding some lights, and putting up cabinets.

loans.use: insulate and remodel her balcony

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta de 33 años de edad posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y buenos precios, Marta vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella solicita un crédito para comprar mas mercadería como: sopas, huevos, detergentes, refrescos, golosinas, granos básicos, etc. para poder atender mejor a los clientes y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Marta is 33 years old and has a store located in her place of residence. She has a lot of clients due to the variety of products and her good prices. Marta lives in her own house with her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise like soup, eggs, detergent, soft drinks, sweets, basic grains, etc. She wants to serve her clients better and have greater profits.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, detergent, soft drinks, sweets, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Teresita has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business. 

She has been in this business for 10 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en:
Flomena is a married woman and has been blessed with six kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Flomena operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Flomena dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, chicken, goats's meat, cow's meat and fried bananas.

loans.name: Daysi Antonia

texts.es: Daysi de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de tortillas su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tienen mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad con que los atiende, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal, y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Daysi is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has been selling tortillas from her home for a few years. She has many customers because of her good prices and friendly customer service. She seeks a loan to buy corn at wholesale and lime.
