Maria, who is 60 years old, went to school through the 8th grade of basic education. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. She has three children, of whom one no longer lives with her because he is married. The others are studying at the university.

Maria sells fish. In the past, she went out to sell it, but now she has a regular location and people come to buy it there. In addition, she and her husband cultivate 2 hectares of corn.

She needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, seeds, and fertilizers to apply to the corn crop.

Her dream is to continue working along with her husband and to have her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, seeds, and fertilizer to apply to her corn crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, blocks, iron, and labor to construct two bedrooms for her home.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 42 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, cereals, milk, juice, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, cereals, milk, juice, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, cereals, milk, juice, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling ready to wear in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman. She has two children, both of whom attend school.

She has operated a business selling paraffin for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase a gallon of parrafin for her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a gallon of parrafin for her business.

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas De Viacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVAS AMIGAS DE VIACHA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de edredones, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, costura de carteras en cuero, venta de salteñas, costura de polleras, elaboración de empanadas, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió recientemente con el primer crédito obtenido en Pro Mujer y con el apoyo de sus amigas quienes le enseñaron la dinámica del comercio de estos productos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece el personal de la institución y el confraternizar con sus compañeras.

En la imagen esta ausente una cliente, la misma se encontraba en el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The savings club "NEW FRIENDS of VIACHAN" will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascade Focal Center. It is made up eight members and is headed by a board in which Maria is the Secretary. 

The various business ventures that members engage in within the community include the following: selling quilts, offering clothing for sale, running a convenience store, sewing leather wallets, selling snacks, sewing skirts, baking empanadas and providing transportation.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesses in which Maria is a partner. She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, joining through an invitation from a friend who was also a client in the organization. 

Currently she runs a business selling clothes; she tells us that she initiated this business recently with a first loan she received through Pro Mujer, and with the support from her friends who taught her the dynamics of selling these products.

The loan she is taking out now will be used to increase her capital (to buy adult clothing), that she will acquire in stores in her town, called El Alto, and subsequently will sell them in her business location. This type of work will allow her to generate the resources to support her family financially since she is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that its staff provides and the camaraderie with her colleagues.

loans.use: buy clothing in wholesale.

loans.name: Bridaine

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de repuestos de carros, la socia vende su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solictan,la socia continua vendiendo llantas, parabrisas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de repuestos  como faros entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues working in her business of selling auto parts. She sells her merchandise to her customers who request it. She continues selling tires and windshields, among other items. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy spare parts such as headlights, among other items.

She feels grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as headlights, among other items.

loans.name: Margarita Isabel

texts.es: Margarita es una joven campesina que vino a la ciudad en busca de oportunidades de progreso, tuvo un primer matrimonio pero al poco tiempo  enviudo,  se volvió a casar pero no ha sido un matrimonio fácil, es madre de 2 hijos por los que lucha a diario para sacarlos adelante, Margarita a diario se levanta muy temprano para atender su negocio que consiste en una comideria, en la actualidad las ventas son muy buenas porque le vende comida a los trabajadores de un proyecto de construcción de vivienda cerca de su casa, por lo que solicita el crédito ya que tiene mucha demanda y con el financiamiento podrá aumentar el número de plastos.
texts.en: Margarita is a young farm girl who came to the city in search of opportunities to progress. She had a first marriage but before long she was widowed. She remarried, but it has not been an easy marriage. She is the mother of two children, whom she struggles every day to raise. Every day Margarita gets up very early to tend to her business, which consists of a cafeteria. At this time the sales are very good because she sells food to the workers in a housing construction project close to her house. For this reason she is applying for the loan, since she has a lot of demand and with the financing she will be able to increase the number of servings she sells.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, seasonings, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela works hard to support her family. Miguela is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Miguela requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Miguela has been in this business for 15 years now.

Miguela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 23-year-old university student majoring in business administration, and she is in her fourth year. She lives with her six family members in Irbid, Jordan. 

Hala is planning to find a job in her study field after graduating so that she will help her family financially. Now she is seeking a loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a 32-year-old mixed farmer who is based in Kapsaret village in the Eldoret area of Kenya. Eldoret is home to world-famous Kenyan marathon runners. It is also home to many dairy farming and maize farming families. 

For the last four years, Cyrus has sustained his family of three children through farming. He sells milk and eggs from the dairy cattle and poultry he keeps at his farm. To boost his income, he also keeps a day job. 

Cyrus is seeking a loan to expand his poultry farming. He will use the money to acquire more birds of poultry. He will go for layers in order to boost egg production. This is suitable to Cyrus since he lives close to the market for eggs. Also, his farm has limited space for free-ranging. Eggs sold from this investment will greatly boost the owner's income. 

Cyrus stated that his family will enjoy an improvement in financial security with the growth of their asset base after he successfully services the loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Renie Rose

texts.en:
Renie Rose is a 26-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Renie Rose has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Renie Rose has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Chizi has operated a food selling business for five years, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: The person appearing in the photo is Eunice. She is forty eight years old, married and a mother of three. Having gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, she has been able to realize her strength in entrepreneurial development. She engages herself in vegetable farming. She wants a loan to boost her vegetable farming by buying manure and fertilizer. She hopes this will improve the yield thus more income. This will ensure she maintains food security in her household. Eunice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Taalaibek

texts.ru: Таалайбек, 47 лет, женат, отец 2 детей. У Таалайбека среднее образование, на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством, также грузоперевозками. На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорству и целеустремленности Таалайбека в его хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойных коровы, 1 бычок, 1 нетель, 10 овец. Есть дополнительный доход от реализации молока местным жителям. Таалайбек хочет приумножить поголовье скота, в связи с этим он обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. На доходы от кредита он хочет увеличить поголовье скота и в скором будущем построить большой сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Taalaibek is 47 years old, and the father of two children.  He has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and the transportation of merchandise for the past 15 years.  Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he currently owns two dairy cows, one young bull, one heifer and 10 sheep.  He makes an additional income from selling milk to the local residents.  

Taalaibek wants to increase his cattle headcount, and for this reason, he has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" to request a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) and buy a cow.  With the earnings from his loan, he would like to further increase his cattle headcount and, in the near future, to build a large barn for his livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to increase his income and build a large barn for his livestock.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан 37 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. У Бурулкан среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже 10 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Бурулкан есть 4 коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Однако этих средств катастрофически не хватает на содержание семьи. Бурулкан одна воспитывает детей, учит их в школе. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита позволят Бурулкан улучшить материальное положение и условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en: Burulkan is 37 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary education.  For the past ten years already, she has been working in agriculture, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS) and she now owns four cows.  Thanks to her very hard work, she makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  However, this amount of money is vastly insufficient to support her family, as Burulkan raises her children alone and sends them to school.  In order to further develop her small business, Burulkan has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy three cows.  The earnings from this loan will allow her to improve her material situation and the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase the income she makes from raising livestock.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
La socia Aurea continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar autopartes como parabrisas entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Aurea continues to make a living with her business selling spare car parts. She has been doing this work for years, and it is going well thanks to her determination every day at work. Aurea wants to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family.

Aurea is applying for a loan in order to buy spare parts for cars, including windscreens.

Aurea is very happy with this loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy spare parts - such as windscreens - for vehicles.

loans.name: José Ismael

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por los escasos recursos económicos, actualmente está acompañado y tiene un hijo el cual ya no vive junto a él porque vive en el extranjero.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde su infancia, actualmente está cultivando una hectárea de maíz, también se dedica a la pesca, esta actividad la realiza desde hace  cinco años y lo aprendió por un amigo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar abonos y fertilizantes y para comprar el equipo de pesca.

Su sueño es tener una buena cosecha y mejorar los ingresos de la pesca y sabe que lo puede logara con la ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old and did not have the opportunity to go to school as his parents were very poor. José has a partner, and a son who now lives abroad.

José has been working in farming since his childhood. He is growing a hectare of corn just now, and also does fishing work. José learned to fish from a friend; he has been doing it for five years.

José needs this loan in order to buy manure, fertiliser and fishing equipment.

José's dream is to have a good harvest and to improve his income from fishing work. He knows that he will be able to do this with the help of a loan.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertiliser and fishing equipment.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
La socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de regalos como peluches, perfumes y juguetes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar adornos, lámparas entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to earn a living selling gifts such as stuffed animals, perfumes, and toys. She has been in this business for a long time thanks to the hard work she dedicates to it every day; and she wants to continue her work so she can support her family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy ornaments, lamps and other items.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy ornaments, lamps, etc.

loans.name: Zoila Amelia

texts.es: Zoila de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo de 21 años quien trabaja como agricultor, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos como: pastelitos de carne, yuca y papas, fritas, enchiladas de frijol, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, desde hace algunos años, Zoila esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materia prima como: yuca, maiz, frijoles, carne, verdura, papas, aceite, etc. y asi pode tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Zoila, 40, lives in her own house with her 21-year-old son who works as a farmer.  She runs a food business and sells meat pies, yucca and potatoes, fried foods, bean enchiladas, etc.  She has been doing this from home for several years.  

Zoila is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as yucca, corn, beans, meat, vegetables, potatoes, oil, etc. to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy yucca, corn, beans, meat, vegetables, potatoes, oil, etc.

loans.name: Hilda Casimira

texts.es:
La socia Casimira pertenece al banco comunal HUAYNA CCAPAC, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 77 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de autor partes de autos como parabrisas, faros entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar faros entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Casimira belongs to the communal bank HUAYNA CCAPAC, which is located in the department of Cusco.  She is 77 years old, a widow and has two children.  In addition to her normal daily activities she has a business selling auto spare parts such as windshields, headlights, etc.  For years she has been in this line of work and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she dedicates to it every day.  Her wish is to continue with the business so she can support her family.

Casimira is requesting a loan to buy headlights and other spare parts.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy headlights and other spare parts.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 35 años de edad, su nivel académico es 8° grado de educación básica, actualmente está casada y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando bachillerato y educación básica, está casada pero su esposo vive en el extranjero.

Sandra se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal, lo aprendió de su madre que se dedicaba a lo mismo.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción  ya que necesita construir una habitación para su hija, además invertirá en su negocio de frutas y verduras.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que también tengan un lugar digno en donde puedan vivir y sabe con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de los créditos lo puede lograr.
texts.en:
Sandra, 35, has an eighth grade education.  She is married and has two children, one in high school and another in elementary school.  Her husband lives overseas.

Sandra sells fruits and vegetables at the municipal market and learned the trade from her mother who did the same thing.  

The loan Sandra is requesting is to buy construction materials to build a room for her daughter.  She also wants to invest in her fruit and vegetable business.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.  She also wants them to have a decent place to live.  She knows that through hard work and with the help of the loan, she can achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room for her daughter, and to invest in her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Iliana Liazochil

texts.es: Iliana de 24 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia desde hace 16 años en la que vive junto a su hija de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida prestando sus servicios en una empresa papelera, y es gracias a ese trabajo que logra sostener la economía familiar. Iliana desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado lo que está causando que con las lluvias sus pertenencias se mojen y se dañen y es por ello que Iliana ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Iliana, 24, is a single mother with a three-year-old daughter, and she has lived in her own home for 16 years.  For quite some time she has earned a living working for a paper company and, thanks to her job, has been able to support the family economy.

Iliana wants to change the roof of her house because it is in disrepair and when it rains her belongings get damaged.  She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, beams and prongs to change the roof of her house.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, beams and prongs to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Yaneth tiene 33 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta laboratorio fotográfico, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, rollos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con todas sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank BUENOS AMIGOS which is located in the district and department of Cusco.  Her name is Yaneth and she is 33 years old and single.  In addition to her normal daily activities, she has a photographic laboratory.  She has been in business for quite some time and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she dedicates to it every day.  Her desire is to continue with her work so she can support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy dyes and rolls as well as other items.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy dyes and rolls, etc.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 14 janvier 1998, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices de revenus. Tous les membres du groupement du vivent dans le même quartier et entretiennent des relations séculaires  de bon voisinage. De plus elles ont en majorité une grande expérience du système des bancs villageois.

Madame Fatoumata (Assise  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 49 ans et mère de 02 filles. Elle est vendeuse de bouillie à base de mil le soir à la devanture de sa maison. Pour se faire elle achète du mil par sac de 50 kg, du lait en poudre pour fermentation en vue de faire du lait caillé, du sucre et divers ingrédients. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.
 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de mil, un demi sac  de sucre, 10 sachets de 500 gr de lait en poudre et divers ingrédients. 

Les bénéfices que génère l’activité lui permettront en plus de renforcer son épargne, de mieux accompagner son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Created on January 14, 1998, the "banc villageois" loan group consists of women who are quite involved in developing income-generating activities. All the group members live in the same neighborhood and maintain good neighborly relations. Most of them also have extensive experience with the "banc villageois" system. 

Mrs. Fatoumata (sitting at the far right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is a 49-year-old married mother of two girls. In the evening she sells porridge made from millet in front of her house. She buys millet by 50-kilo bags, milk powder to make sour milk, sugar and other ingredients. After years of practice she has acquired a solid experience in this domain.
 
She intends to use her new loan to buy two bags of millet, half a bag of sugar, ten half-kilo pouches of powdered milk and other ingredients. 

Revenues generated by the activity will enable her to bolster her savings, and also to support her husband in taking care of family needs.

loans.use: buy two bags of millet, half a bag of sugar, 10 half-kilo pouches of powdered milk and other ingredients.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: A mother in her early 50s residing in the Thmor Kol district of Battambang province, Phally is a married mother blessed with five children. Nowadays, she needs to support only one child who is in school. For her family, three hectares of rice farming is the single source of income to secure the basic needs of the household. This is the third loan for Phally and her co-borrower. She has managed her past loan wisely to improve her living conditions and she has fully repaid her past loan. For Phally, her entire loan portion will be spent on rice seed and fertilizer for her cash crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed and fertilizer for her cash crop.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 41 years old and married with three children, all of whom are currently in school. Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, and shampoo. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana de 58 años de edad, no estudió ningún grado, ya que sus padres por ser pobres no le pudieron dar los estudios, es viuda, de los 7 hijos solo 2 viven con ella, los otros ya están casados, por lo que 2 personas dependen de ella.

Ana se dedica a la agricultura, lo aprendió de parte de sus padres, ademas tienen árboles de marañón, de los cuales extrae las semillas para vender, esto lo aprendió con su esposo y le ayudan sus 2 hijos, horario de trabajo no tiene pues desde muy temprano empieza a realizar las labores.

Ella necesita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura y para comprar productos de primera necesidad ya que quiere tener una tienda en su casa.

Ella dice que ya cumplió con sus sueños, solo le pide a Dios fuerza para poder ayudar a sus 2 hijos, en todo lo que ellos necesiten y poder tener una tienda en su hogar para ya no tener que salir de su casa todos los días.
texts.en:
Ana is 58 years old. She never went to school, since her parents, being poor, couldn't afford it for her. She is a widow with seven children, of whom only two live with her. The others are married, so she has two dependents. 

Ana works in agriculture, which she learned from her parents. They also have cashew trees, from which she harvests the nuts to sell. She learned this with her husband and her two sons helped her. She doesn't have a work schedule but she starts working very early in the morning.

She needs the loan to invest in agriculture, and to buy essential goods, as she wants to run a store out of her house.

She says that her own dreams have already come true, she only asks God for the strength to be able to help her two sons with everything that they need, and to be able to have a store at home so she doesn't have to leave her house every day.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture, and to buy essential goods, as she wants to run a store out of her house

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Chickens form the largest proportion of domesticated poultry birds in Kenya. Farmers like Ephantus do chicken keeping for its cultural and commercial value. He has kept poultry for over two decades on his mixed farm. He also keeps dairy cattle and grows tea in order to make more income from different revenue streams. However, for him to maintain a family of four children, he needs more income. 

Ephantus is seeking a loan to expand his poultry farm. By purchasing more poultry, he is going to significantly increase the farm's output and, consequently, his income. He spends a lot of time working on his land and attending to his animals. He has enough time, space and knowledge to take in more poultry. Income from this investment will enable him to repay the loan and to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Maria Pilar

texts.es: María de 44 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos una joven de 15 años y 2 varones de 12 y 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que desde hace 15 años se gana la vida con su venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños la cual realiza en los cantones cercanos a su localidad, además vende sandalias de mujer. María anteriormente solicito un crédito a FUSAI el cual invirtió en construir un muro y encementar el piso de su vivienda, por lo que tiene el deseo de seguir mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por medio de la construcción de un tapial que brinde mayor seguridad a los suyos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un tapial alrededor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her three children; she has a 15-year-old daughter and two sons ages 12 and 5. She is a woman who has, for the past 15 years, made her living selling clothing for men, women, and children, which she does in the cantons near her community. She also sells women's sandals. 

Maria had previously requested a loan with FUSAI, which she invested in building a wall and cementing the floor of her house, so she wants to keep improving her family's living conditions by building a tamped earth wall which will keep them safer. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a tamped earth wall around her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a tamped earth wall around her house

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vicenta is 52 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Vicenta has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. Vicenta has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her vegetable-vending business.

Vicenta has been in this business for six years. In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off a debt and invest in purchasing materials for making clay handicrafts, such as clay, paint and decorations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for manual labor to help her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ana Roxana

texts.es:
Ana de 30 años de edad, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta Bachillerato, su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella y de los cuales 1 esta estudiando, en casa también vive su madre  por lo que son 3 personas las que dependen de Ana.

Ana actualmente se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y lo ha hecho desde que era niña, lo aprendió por medio de sus padres y además se dedica a vender comida típica en su casa por las tardes, se levanta muy temprano junto con su pareja para trasladarse a pie al lugar de trabajo, regresa a su casa a las 11:00 am donde comienza las labores del hogar.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar ladrillos, cemento y pagar mano de obra para construir una habitación en su casa.

Sus sueños son darles el estudio a sus hijos para que tengan un buen trabajo y tener una mejor vivienda, sabe que con la ayuda de Dios y los créditos lo podrá hacer posible.
texts.en:
Ana, 30 years old, had the opportunity to study until high school. Her partner works in agriculture. She has two children who live with her, one of whom is currently studying. Ana's mother also lives with her, which means that Ana has three dependants.

Ana currently works in agriculture and has done so since she was a young girl. She learned it from her parents. In addition, she sells traditional foods from her home in the afternoons. Ana and her partner wake up very early to go on foot to their place of work. She returns home at 11:00 am, where she starts on household tasks.

The money from this loan will be used to buy bricks, cement and to pay for manual labour in order to build a room in her home.

Ana's dreams are to provide an education to her children so that they can get good jobs, and to have a better home. She knows that, with the help of God and these loans, it will be possible.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement and to pay for labour to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Evelith

texts.en:
Evelith is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelith is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Evelith has a fish selling business in the Philippines. Evelith requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Evelith has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Evelith would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 65 years old and widowed with three children.  

Cristina is in the agricultural business. She works fattening pigs in the Philippines. Cristina requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cristina has been in the pig fattening business for eight years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activities.

Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of home and electronic appliances to be able to attract many customers

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL BUEN SAMARITANO, él banco  esta ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Urubamba.
La socia Ana tiene 43 años de edad es casada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras como zanahorias, tomates entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio l cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de zanahorias.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "El Buen Samaritano" ["The Good Samaritan"]. The bank is located in the province of Urubamba and the department of Urubamba. 

The member, Ana, is 43 years old and married with three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business, where she sells vegetables like carrots and tomatoes, among others. She has been in this business for a good amount of time, and it is going well thanks to the daily effort she puts in.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase carrots. She feels thankful for the loan awarded and is committed to making her established loan repayments.

loans.use: to purchase carrots.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vehicle transport. Victorina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Victorina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and the mother of two kids. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years she has been operating a beauty salon business. She operates from home, and neighbours and passersby are her potential customers. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding in the future in order to accommodate more customers.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and with the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase a hair drying machine for her beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase a hair drying machine for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL BUEN SAMARITANO, él banco  está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Urubamba.
La socia Elsa tiene 46 años de edad es conviviente  y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de prendas de vestir, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio l cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de telas, tijeras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the communal bank “El Buen Samaritano” [The Good Samaritan], located in the Urubamba province, department of Urubamba.

Elsa is 46 years old. She is in a relationship and has three children. Besides the daily chores, she works making clothes. She has been doing this for a long time and is doing well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business.

Elsa is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, scissors and other supplies. She is happy to receive this loan and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy farics, scissors and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 45 years old, and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Regina works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, bread, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, candies, eggs, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, candies, eggs, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, bread, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, candies, eggs, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Dairy farming has always played a core role in East Africa. The predominant type of dairy farming, traditional subsistence farming, is done mainly in small scale for survival. Thomas has kept dairy animals for the last three years on his farm in the Eldoret area of Kenya. Since Thomas had children, his personal and financial obligations have skyrocketed. He has different ways to make money, but kept coming up short. 

He decided the best way to grow economically was to improve his farm's productivity. To increase milk production, he could either buy more cows or replace the existing cows with more productive breeds. The later made more economic sense. Traditional breeds are well-adjusted to the environmental conditions and disease resistance, but their milk production is very low. Cross-breeds and Friesians are more productive, and can survive in the same environment as the traditional breeds, but they come at a price. 

Thomas is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a productive dairy cow that will bring him more income. 

He will use the additional income to pay for his children's education, and meet family expenses. His future plan is to keep growing his income-generating asset base.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 41 years old and has three children. She is married, and has one child who is currently in school.

Delia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Delia has been in pig fattening for 13 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Salama is a mother of two daughters who are in school. She is not married, and is aged in her thirties. She has been supporting her family by running two enterprises. She owns a grocery selling beers, sodas and waters and secondly, she owns a charcoal store where she purchases bags of charcoal, puts it in small sacks and resells it. Salama works from 07:30am to midnight each working day and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is her second credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous credit, since repaid, to buy sacks of charcoal and drinks. She managed her previous credit for her business well, and got extra income. She used the profit to cover school fees, household expenses and saved for unforeseen events. She is happy with Kiva's support. In the coming years, Salama would like to grow her businesses and become better off in life. 

Salama will use her new request to restock her both businesses. She will share this loan with her loan group,Wazo Tegeta which consist of two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock both her businesses.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 46 years now.

Loreta requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Loreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Terry is 34 years old, and has five children who are in school.

Terry has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail polish, nippers, etc. for her business.

Terry has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail polish, nippers, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is widowed, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Jevy

texts.en:
Jevy is 37 years old and married with four children.

He earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Jevy is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed, vitamins and other supplies for his business.

Jevy has been raising livestock for eight years, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

He is working tirelessly towards the attainment of his dream: to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Kimeli

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Kimeli. Born in 1984, Kimeli has grown to be an independent young man who is so much into dairy farming. He lives in Kamagut village, which is located in the North Rift region of Kenya. He owns three acres of land, and has employed one full-time worker to help him to run the mixed-farm. He grows maize that he harvests once annually. He also keeps dairy cows that provide him with regular income through out the year.

Kimeli is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The additional cow will produce more milk for the farmer to sell. The increase in income will come in handy considering he has four direct dependants. 

Most of the income will be spent on food and farm transportation expenses. He plans to capitalize on this loan to uplift his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is married and has one child. She is requesting a loan of GHS 2,800 to buy additional supplies to keep in her business, making waakye (cooked rice and beans). She has been doing business for many years, and started this business with her own working capital of GHS 50. 

She's taking a loan from ID-Ghana to increase her income, and she wants to open supply joints in the future. She is happy with the loan that was offered by ID-Ghana for her to have more working capital to buy more rice, cooking oil, fish, and tomatoes, to prepare waakye (cooked rice and beans) and sell it to customers. 

She promises to repay without trouble; this is her eighth loan cycle.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, fish, tomato, to prepare waakye

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is married and has two children. She is requesting a loan of GHS 2,500 to buy additional supplies to keep in her business, including tea, bread, eggs and noddles. She has been doing business for 24 years and started this business with the help of her husband. 

She's taking a loan from ID-Ghana to increase her income and she wants to do this business for a very long time. She is happy with the loan that was offered by ID-Ghana for her to have more working capital to buy more bread, milo, milk, eggs and noddles to sell to customers. She promises to repay without trouble. This is her 9th loan cycle.

loans.use: To buy more bread, milo, milk, eggs and noddles, to sell to customers.

loans.name: Las Florecitas Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango is a large town in southern Guatemala known for its traditional Maya K’iche’ culture, and its famous market days on Thursdays and Sundays where vendors sell everything from chickens to flowers to handicrafts. Here a group of fifteen motivated businesswomen has formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, called “Las Florecitas”, or “Little Flowers.” The members are all very proud of their K’iche’ culture and heritage. This group is starting its second loan cycle with Kiva, and they report that the previous loan cycle was successful. 

Petronila is the treasurer of the Trust Bank. She is single and has a 16-year-old son who attends school. Having completed three years of primary school, she is very pleased that her son is receiving an education and therefore will have more opportunities. This hardworking woman produces and sells traditional textiles. She currently employs five other female weavers who produce the textiles. The demand for her beautiful handmade goods motivates her to hire additional weavers, and purchase thread and supplies in order to diversify her products and increase sales. Therefore, she is requesting a new loan from Kiva. 

The ladies of the Trust Bank benefit immensely from the educational sessions at their monthly meetings. During the Friendship Bridge meetings, they acquire new personal and business tools that enable them to gain more self-confidence and self-esteem. The combination of the loans and education, which Friendship Bridge calls “Microcredit Plus,” is very effective for the ladies to empower themselves. Petronila and the women of “Las Florecitas” are very appreciative of the generosity Kiva investors show in funding their loans, and look forward to a brighter future for themselves, their families and their community in Chichi. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To buy products in bulk like fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Beijing Group

texts.en:
Anifa is aged in her late thirties, married and has two kids, one boy and one girl of whom one is at school and another still young. She runs a business making mishkaki (shish kebab), selling sodas and waters, a business she has been in for five years now. Anifa works from 8am to 4pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is her first credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. The loan will be apportioned among three members from Beijing group. Beijing members will hold each other responsible for paying back the loan. 

Anifa will use her credit to buy meat, sodas, water and cooking oil for her food cooking business. She want to rise her cooking level to the extent of making more mishkaki and selling more drinks.

loans.use: to buy meat, sodas, water and cooking oil for her food cooking business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old and married with five children.

Maribel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Maribel has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Maribel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosa is 51 years old and has seven children who are in school.

Rosa has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Rosa requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

Rosa has been in this business for 33 years. In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe Yadira

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe has a beautiful family, she has four children, two in middle school and two in preschool. With the help of her husband they try to give them the best possible life and provide them with a good example. Maria Guadalupe sells women clothes such as blouses, sweaters, skirts, etc. She started the business 25 years ago, and through hard work she has been able to maintain it and see it grow. 

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for the cold weather season. Her biggest accomplishment is starting and maintaining her business, her goal is to start selling wholesale.

loans.use: To buy products for the cold weather season such as sweaters.

loans.name: Kisoga Group

texts.en:
Lucy is a businesswoman running a local restaurant serving breakfast food consisting of chapati, porridge, banana porridge made of meat-soup and banana, and lastly, soup. She runs this business from 04:50 am to midday, and is able to make a small monthly profit. She believes if her restaurant stays open until the night, she will be in a better way to receive much more. Lucy is a single woman who is her 20's, and has got one schooling daughter. 

The local restaurant is her only business, and the core source of income to her family. She wakes too early in the morning, 04:50am, and leaves her daughter at home sometimes, but this is the way she must live her life.

She is now at Tujijenge Tanzania, Kiva's partner, to request her first credit. She will be so thankful with your support. Lucy will share this loan with her group, 'KISOGA', which consists of eight members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Lucy will invest her portion of loan to buy cooking ingredients for her restaurant so as to run her business until the night. Her desire is to grow her business more so she can have more projects.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her store so as to run her business up to night.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel paid his previous loan on time. He is now asking for a loan to make some home improvements for some rooms that he will rent. 

He drives a taxi and also rents some rooms to earn extra income. His biggest accomplishment is building a patrimony. He built his house, and also some of the rooms that he rents.

loans.use: To fix some rooms to rental.

loans.name: Eduardo Jossue

texts.es:
Eduardo de 30 años de edad. Actualmente vive solo con su esposa que se dedica a la cosmetología, y su hija de 6 años de edad que está estudiando preparatoria. Eduardo antes se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos, pero sintió que no le generaba los suficientes ingresos para darles una buena alimentación a su hija, fue en 2011 que adquirió un trabajo de ordenanza en el Órgano Judicial y desde entonces la ha generado mejores ingresos y un mayor crecimiento en su economía.

El dinero lo necesita para invertir en arreglar el techo de 2 habitaciones, ya que para esta época es difícil vivir así por la lluvia, y lo demás de su préstamo lo utilizara para algunos gastos personales que se le han presentado. 

Eduardo quiere en un futuro mejorar su vivienda y hacerla mas grande.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 30 years old. Currently he only lives with his wife who works as a beautician, and his daughter of 6 years old who goes to elementary school. Eduardo used to work growing staple grains, but felt that it didn't generate enough enough income to give his daughter good nutrition, it was in 2011 that he got a job working as a messenger in the Judicial Branch and since then he has made a better income and a greater increase in his savings.

He needs the money to invest in fixing the roof in two rooms, as in this season it is difficult to live like that due to the rain, and also the loan will be use for some personal expenses that have come up.

Eduardo wants a to improve his house in the future and make it bigger.

loans.use: to fix the roof in two rooms.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 60 years old and married with five children.

Avelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, milk, juice, noodles, etc., to sell.

Avelina has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Avelina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, milk, juice, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 50 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos solo estudió hasta 3º grado, está acompañada y su pareja está en Estados Unidos, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella y le ayudan a trabajar en la agricultura, por lo que son 2 personas las que dependen María.

Actualmente, María se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y lo ha hecho desde que era niña, lo aprendió por parte de su padre, además de esto ella trabaja en una finca. Se traslada 2 kilómetros a pie para llegar a su lugar de trabajo y lo hace de 7:00 AM hasta las 12 del mediodía y cuando regresa a su casa a trabajar en las labores domésticas. 


Ella necesita el crédito para pagar una deuda que tiene en otra institución financiera. 


Sus sueños son tener una mejor vivienda, tener escrituras de su propiedad ya que fue una donación, también desea seguir trabajando para llevar la comida a su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old, due to a lack of financial resources she only studied up to 3rd grade, she has a partner and he is in the United States, she has 3 children of which 2 live with her and work in agriculture, so there are 2 people who are dependent on Maria.

Currently, Maria works in agriculture and she has done since she was young, she learnt it from her father, she also works on a farming estate. She travels 2 kilometers to reach her place of work and she works from 7:00 AM to 12 noon and when she gets home she does the domestic chores.

She needs this loan to pay a debt that she has at another financial institution.

Her dreams are to have a better house, to have the deeds on her property as it was a gift, also she wants to continue working to bring food home to her house.

loans.use: to pay the loan she has in another financial institution.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.en:
Efraín describes himself as a working, gentle, and dedicated person. He operates a shop in which he buys and sells different kinds of items for the holiday season. Efraín has developed different kinds of businesses with his brothers all of which related to sales. 

Efrain requested a loan, which he will use to buy products for his store. He believes that by offering more product variety he will be able to attract more customers and increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the holiday season

loans.name: Perosi

texts.en:
Perosi is 58 years old and married with five children. She has a massive plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Perosi needs a loan to buy a second-hand pickup, chemicals, sprayers, a chainsaw, a wheelbarrow, four machetes and a tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

Perosi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand pickup, chemicals, sprayers, a chainsaw, a wheelbarrow, four machetes and a tiller

loans.name: Soonalote

texts.en:
Soonalote is 30 years old and unmarried with two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for eight years. 

Soonalote needs a loan to buy a new chest freezer, canned items, frozen goods, soft drinks, snacks, candy and bags of rice. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2006 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new chest freezer, canned items, frozen goods, soft drinks, snacks, candy and bags of rice

loans.name: Losivale

texts.en:
Losivale is 29 years old and married with 3 children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 5 years. Losivale needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, canned items, frozen goods, snacks and soft drinks. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, canned items, frozen goods, snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kakchiquel San Marcos Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank “Kakchiquel San Marcos,” composed of eight members, is about to begin their second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge.  Virginia, a 22-year old single woman, is a member of the Trust Bank who dreams of creating a better and more prosperous future. 

The owner of a textile business, Virginia has been creating traditional clothing since she was a child. Because San Marcos attracts tourists, Virginia wants to have plenty of inventory on hand so that she can earn income to help support her family. Her biggest dream is to save money in order to return to school and at least finish her secondary education. She plans to use her loan to purchase a wide variety of threads with the goal of improving her textile production.

The ladies of the Trust Bank have improved their quality of life not only because of the small loans they have received but also because of their increased knowledge about a variety of subjects. A portion of their monthly meetings is set aside for educational purposes. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares relevant and useful information with the ladies on a wide variety of subjects including preventative health, nutrition, hygiene, self-esteem and women’s rights. The ladies learn how to use their loans most effectively as they learn about business planning, budgeting, accounting, marketing and customer service. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus”. 

Virginia and her friends in the “Kakchiquel San Marcos” Trust Bank thank KIVA investors for their loans. They face a brighter tomorrow as empowered women eliminating poverty.  We will report again on their progress!

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of threads for improving her textile production.

loans.name: Sinuu

texts.en:
Sinuu is 55 years old and married with seven children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for five years. 

Sinuu needs a loan to buy a chest freezer, a display fridge, a hanging scale, a cash register machine, bags of flour, sugar, rice, a sack of onions and soft drinks. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a chest freezer, a display fridge, a hanging scale, a cash register machine, bags of flour, sugar, rice, a sack of onions and soft drinks

loans.name: Sonia Veronica

texts.es: Sonia de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su padre y sus 2 hermanos de 19 y 17 años de edad. Ella es una mujer admirable que desde hace mucho tiempo se esfuerza por apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar apoyada en su trabajo de elaboración de prendas de vestir. Sonia desea realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda ya que no cuenta con este servicio tan importante para la convivencia de la familia y su misma calidad de vida. Sonia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre, interruptores y caja térmica para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sonia is 23 years old and lives in her own home with her father and her 2 brothers of 19 and 17 years old. She is an admirable woman who for a very long time has strived to support her family with the household expenses, supported by her job in making clothing.

Sonia wants to have electricity installed in their home as it doesn't yet have this very important service for the family living together and also her quality of life. Sonia has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in: wire, switches and a solar panel to install electricity in her home.

loans.use: to buy wire, switches and a solar panel to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is single and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

Erlinda has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 67 years old and widowed with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nenita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like coffee, bread, sugar, etc., to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 10 years. Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like coffee, bread, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 40 years old, widowed, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. She earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.

Chona requested her sixth loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks to sell in her general store. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Boneta

texts.en:
Boneta is 56 years old and married with five children.

Boneta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Boneta has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Boneta aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
Maricela is a 30-year-old single mom with an 11 year old child. 

Maricela is dedicated to her bakery business all day long. Her business objective is to offer the best quality in her products as well as a competitive price. 

She requires this loan for making home improvements like painting and restorations.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is driven by a passion in selling. At the age of 56, she is a widow in Tudela who runs a store that primarily supports her family. Every day, she never gets tired tending her store. 

Loreta is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
In 2011, Generosa joined Paglaum MPC for the financial assistance it gives start-ups. A married mother of six, Generosa has been a farmer for 30 years in Tangub City, Philippines. She earns a meager income in the amount of Php 5,000 each month, just enough for the family's needs. 

Recently, Generosa tried her luck and took a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Generosa feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. She recently requested another loan to purchase farm fertilizer for her corn production. 

Generosa wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizer

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon has signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small-time borrower like her. 

Corazon is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount (build) a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa, 36, is a married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonisa has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle transport business. She has been in this business for 12 years. 

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

In the future, Leonisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 54 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lucia has a general store business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Lucia has been in this business for four years. Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Erdenebulgan

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebulgan, 29 years old, lives with his wife and two children in an old barn in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as machinist at a manufacturing company since 2012. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, taking care of domestic work. 

The barn his family lives in has deteriorated over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy building materials such as planks, cement and fiberglass in order to renovate his barn so that his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his barn in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, 53, is a married woman with eight children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Loreta has a food-vending business in the Philippines.She has been in this business for two years. 

Loreta requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her business.

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda, 54, is a married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Rosalinda requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Ma. Seina

texts.en:
Ma. Seina is 44 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Ma. Seina works very hard to provide for the family.

Ma. Seina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Seina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, seasonings, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, juice, milk, coffee, etc. 

Ma. Seina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg, 43 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as an operator at a carpet factory since 2008. Her husband is an electrician and works at a mining company. Their elder daughter studies at university, while the younger daughter goes to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy furniture such as a sofa, drawers and closet for her house so that her family will live in a comfortable and decorated place where their daughters can do their homework in comfort.

loans.use: to buy furniture such as a sofa, drawers and closet

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 34 years old and married. She has four children who are in school.

Ellen is in the agricultural business, raising poultry in the Philippines. She has been raising poultry for two years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ellen requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her poultry.

In the future, Ellen would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her poultry.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 45 years old and has two children. Rebecca is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Rebecca is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano de 43 años  de edad casado residente de Suchitepéquez, se ha dedicado a una de las profesiones más solemnes que existen en toda sociedad como lo es la docencia. El es una persona que está decidido a enseñar a los niños lo que el a aprendido en los años de estudios que el realizo en la comunidad donde el vive, el tiene 4 hijos dos de ellos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

La  actividad que el realiza es docente en Suchitepéquez desde hace más de veinte años, pero lo ha sentido desde pequeño.  Sus alumnos lo esperan siempre cada mañana para que victoriano le imparta el saber de la vida para el desarrollo de su comunidad.

El motivo de la realización del préstamo es para la compra de terreno que el a anhelado tanto desde un tiempo atrás para  poder dejárselos a sus hijo en un futuro.

También la docencia le ha provisto una fuente económica para el sustento de su familia y de su comunidad.  Su sueño es poder instalar un negocio de internet en la comunidad donde le vive par generar ingresos económico extras de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Victoriano, age 43, lives in Suchitipéquez.  He has devoted himself to ones of the most dignified professions that exists, which is teaching.  He is a person who is determined to teach children what he has learned during his years when he went to school in the community where he lives.

He has four children, and two of them already have their own families.  The last two are students in the community school.

He has been a teacher in Suchitepéquez for over 20 years.  But, he has felt this way since he was little.  Every morning his students wait for Victoriano to impart the knowledge of life for the betterment of his community.

The reason for the loan is to buy a piece of land that he has yearned for so much for some time.  He wants to do this to be able to leave it for his children in the future.

Teaching has provided a source of income to support his family and his community.

His dream is to be able to set up an internet business in the community where he lives.  He would like to do this in order to generate extra income from his work.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, 46, is a married woman with five children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Francisca has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Francisca requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more kinds of vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more kinds of vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 44 years old and married with four children who are all in school.

She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. She has been raising poultry for 16 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Adela is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her poultry.
