She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her poultry.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 36 years old and married with one child in school. Helen works very hard to provide for her family.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, sardines and other groceries. 

Helen requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

In the future Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra is 50 years old and married with six children. With two children still in school, Pedra works very hard to provide for them.

Pedra runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, sanitary pads, cereals, seasonings, etc.  

Pedra requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, sanitary pads, cereals, seasonings, etc. to sell.

In the future, Pedra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, sanitary pads, cereals, seasonings, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 43 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Nelly has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Nelly requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business. 

In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: April Rose

texts.en:
April Rose is 20 years old and married. She has one child.  

April Rose is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in the pig-fattening business for 10 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

April Rose requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

April Rose would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 59 years old and married. She has five children. Salvacion works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as hair conditioner, detergent soap, sugar, eggs, biscuits, etc.

Salvacion requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like hair conditioner, detergent soap, sugar, eggs, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Salvacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like hair conditioner, detergent soap, sugar, eggs, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Susan runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She  sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, cereals, coffee, shampoo, etc. 

Susan requested her second loan from NWTF for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more items to sell in her general store. In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen is 38 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a hardworking father who is helping his family by providing tailoring services in his community, which he has been doing for many years. He knows the techniques of stitching very well. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He has been operating his tailoring business at home, but now he wants to open a tailoring shop in the market and does not have enough cash to buy a sewing machine.

Noreen requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her husband, which he will use to set up his tailoring shop by buying a new sewing machine, packs of zippers, buttons, and laces. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues for personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, packs of zippers, buttons, and laces for her husband's stitching services

loans.name: Pompia

texts.en:
Pompia is 58 years old and widowed with two children.

Pompia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Pompia has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Pompia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Kausar's Group

texts.en:
Kausar is a 42 year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. Her husband provides whitewash and oil painting services to his customers in the community; sometimes he also has to go out of the city.

He has got a new contract for whitewash and oil painting of a newly constructed house but he has no paint brushes or rollers for providing services.
Kausar has requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc. His savings are very poor that is why he is unable to buy new tools for providing whitewashing services. 

She wants to change the situation of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc for her husband's whitewashing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her potato crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, new stencils, rubber designs, brushes and rollers.

loans.name: Anapogi

texts.en: Anapogi is a 42-year-old unmarried woman with 3 children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has 5 years of experience with this business. Anapogi needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits and flippers. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Anapogi has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits and flippers.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en: Paula is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Paula needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, butter, basins, a large stove, baking trays and icing sugar. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Paula has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, butter, basins, a large stove, baking trays and icing sugar.

loans.name: Uugantsetseg

texts.en: Uugantsetseg, 42 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as technologist at a private firm since 2002. Her husband is an operator of a heavy truck at a mining company. Their children study at university. Her family lives in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. As winter is coming, she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass, foam and felts in order to renovate her ger. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her ger in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en: Enkhbold, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been driving his minivan for transportation since 2005. His wife stays at home, looking after their one-year-old daughter. Their elder daughter goes to high school and at the same time helps her father in his business. He is requesting  a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts such as a tuner, spark plugs and a brake rotor in order to repair his minivan. This minivan is the main income source for his family and this loan he is requesting is very important for his family.

loans.use: to repair his minivan.

loans.name: Dashdorj

texts.en: Dashdorj, 37 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been sewing clothes since 2006. Her husband renders taxi service. Their youngest child stays at kindergarten and the other three children go to high school. Using her previous loan, she has purchased an electric car for her husband. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy an electric heater for her house so that her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to install an electric heater in order to reduce coal usage for heating.

loans.name: Hermogena

texts.en: Hermogena, 42 years of age, is married to a motorcycle driver, who earns PHP 400 daily. She owns and manages a transportation business in their village and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their electric bills. Due to insufficient funds from her business, she would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to pay for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle. She is hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en: Prescilla is 53 years old, married and has grown-up children. Prescilla is selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. She offers her products on a house-to-house basis because she has no vegetable stall yet. She wants to gain more profits that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more vegetables (eggplant, string beans, tomatoes and squash). She hopes to keep extending good products and services and continuously gain good profits for future use.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables (eggplant, string beans, tomatoes and squash) to sell.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: Chanthorn, 48, is mother of four children living in Kampong Chhnang province. She earns income via food-selling and rice cropping. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel to support her family’s needs. She hopes that her house has electricity to use.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel to support her family’s needs.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Tralach District

loans.name: Al Saada Group

texts.en:
Nawal is the featured borrower for Al Saada group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Nawal is a 61-year-old widowed mother who opened a grocery shop four years ago to cover her family’s living needs and expenses, after her husband passed away.

Today, she is acquiring a loan to increase her business merchandise with newly released and special-offer products to satisfy her customers and provide them with better service.

Nawal is on the right, Joumana is the lady standing in the middle, and Nouha is the lady on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with newly released and special-offer products.

loans.name: Claudia Ester

texts.es:
Claudia  de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta bachiller,  el esposo se dedica al comercio en una tienda, han procreado 4 hijos en esta relación; uno de ellos está con ella los demás ya están en hogares apartes y trabajando.

Claudia se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su hogar, antes ella administraba la tienda junto a su esposo, pero por problemas la quitaron, pero hoy desean volver a abrirla.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar más gaseosas, churros, dulces y galletas para surtir la tienda,  ya que con el crédito anterior fue poco lo que adquirió porque iba iniciando y tenía que  ver si en el lugar daba esa tienda y así ella vio que si es un buen lugar de comercio; así que hoy pondrá más cosas que los niños buscan, pero también ella pondrá cosas de la canasta básica como aceite, arroz, frijoles,  azúcar y huevos son cosas que a diario se venden porque la gente lo consume esto le va a ayudar mucho, ya que le hace falta tener la tienda que ellos habían quitado por problemas de otras personas pero ya ellos no están entonces la pondrán poco a poco poder surtirla más y más.


El sueños de Claudia  son poder tener nuevamente la tienda, ya que antes ella, su hijo y el esposo eran muy felices con este ingreso.
texts.en:
Claudia, 43 years old, has a high school diploma. Her husband is a salesman in a store.  They have four children from this marriage.  One lives with her and the others are working and live elsewhere.   

Claudia works at housework at home.  Previously, she ran the store together with her husband but becauses of probelms they closed their store. Now they want to open the store again.

The loan she is seeking from CREDICAMPO is to buy soft drinks, doughnuts, sweets and cookies to stock the store, since with the previous loan they were unable to get much because they were just starting the business and had to see if the store would do well  in this location.  She has discovered that, yes,  this is a good place for sales; so now she will provide more things that the young people are looking for, but also items frolm the basic food basket like oil, rice, beans, sugar and eggs.  These are things that are sold daily because people use them a lot; this will help the business..  They have missed having the store that they closed due to other people's problems but now those people aren't around, so they have the store going and little by little will be able to stock it more and more completely.  

Claudia's dream is to succeed in running their store again, since before she, her son and her husband were very happy with this income.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, doughnuts, sweets and biscuits, oil, rice, beans and sugar and also eggs.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng is a 24-year-old married woman with a small child from a village in Takeo Province, Cambodia and she is a photo designer. She has been in this work since 2013. Her husband is 26 years old; he buys second-hand motorcycles to resell for profit. Together, they can earn approximately $60 a day. Now Sokheng would like to request a loan for her husband to buy more second-hand motorcycles to resell. This loan will help her husband earn more income. 

In the future, she is going to keep expanding her husband’s business, build a new house and support her child to have high education.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand motorcycles to resell

loans.name: Tanjung Rijasa Group

texts.en:
The Tanjung Rijasa Group from Pejarakan (near Pemuteran) in the north part of Bali would like to thank lenders for their support. Luh Putu, the group head, purchased piglets with her loan and raised them over several months, during which they became large and healthy.  At the end of the loan period, Luh Putu sold her pigs for 1,100,000 IDR each, yielding a respectable profit.  With her profits, and with the help of a new loan from MUK, she plans to purchase additional pigs.  With the overall increase in household income, she has supported the daily needs of her family and is saving for sudden needs.

The Tanjung Rijasa Group got a loan for the second time. There are 10 members and the total loan is 20.000.000 IDR. (Two member couldn't attend the meeting because of illness.)  Having been successful with fattening pigs, Luh Putu used this loan to purchase four types of local pigs for pork roll and will maintain them for two months. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy feed. The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about her business going forward. With her profits, she plans to repair her home and also invest in her pig business.

loans.use: to purchase four types of local pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is grateful that he was granted a PHP 50,000 loan which he used to buy sacks of rice needed in his wholesale/retail rice business. Through his earnings he is able to support his family and meet their daily basic needs.

He would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan which he will use to buy several sacks of rice to sell either at wholesale or retail prices. Rice is a main staple in the Philippines. It constitutes a dominant portion of the standard diet of Filipinos. His earnings from selling rice help cover his family’s daily needs. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to him.

Jorge dreams of being more successful in his rice selling business. He aims to save for his old age and prays to stay healthy. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more sacks of rice needed in his business.

loans.name: Aleksandr

texts.en:
Aleksandr is 55 years old and he lives in Vanadzor, a city in the Lori region. He has vocational education and he has worked in different places doing various constructional work. Now Aleksandr works at the medical center as a guard. He is married; his wife is unemployed now. They have a daughter who works at the same clinic as Aleksandr, where she is an administrator. She is a pretty, 23-year-old young lady, and she is going to get married.

Aleksandr asks for a loan in an amount of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to be able to organize a nice wedding party for his daughter, because he greatly wants to see his daughter be happy and beautiful on that day and ever after.

loans.use: to organize a nice wedding party for his daughter

loans.name: Lenneth

texts.en:
Lenneth is 38 years old and has two children. She is married, and she has one child who is currently in school. Lenneth is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Lenneth has been in the pig-fattening business for 2 year, now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lenneth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar is 45 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles, such as motorbikes, motor cars, and auto rickshaws, which he has been doing for many years. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, including the turbine and radiators. Up to now, his business has been very steady, but due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts, the whole mechanism of the lathe machine is affected.

Kausar's husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or buy cutting tools. Kausar requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her husband, which he will use to fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools to work over the lathe machine. Kausar hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to fix the lathe machine and purchase cutting tools.

loans.name: Phanny

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Phanny is 42 years old and a mother of three children. She can earn income to improve her family condition via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. Moreover, she can earn more income via raising cows. 

For Phanny, this is her first time with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to pay school fees for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in banking. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has one son. She lives together with her family in an Ashakli community in very poor conditions and environment. 

Even though her husband is unemployed, like many in their community, Valentina is a very hardworking woman and has taken the initiative to start her own business selling used clothing for men and women. She is confident that she will be able to make a profit and earn a living through her business and is requesting a loan in order to pay for the start-up costs. 

Her husband is very proud of her and happy that they will have an opportunity to have better living conditions. They both really appreciate the help.

loans.use: To pay for the start-up costs to start her own business selling used clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix  es originario de Sololá, de 36 años de edad,  tiene cuatro hijos de 7, 6, 3  años de edad y el ultimo de 3 meses de nacido, por quienes tiene que luchar para poder satisfacer sus necesidades y la de su familia.

La actividad principal que realiza es la compra y venta de materiales de construcción por medio de ello puede tener un ingreso económico para el sustente de su familia, esta actividad  lo aprendió de su hermano que estuvieron trabajando por un tiempo de 4 años por lo cual el tomo esa iniciativa de poner su propio negocio para tener mejores ingresos económicos, el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante más de 10 años y es una muy buena fuente de ingresos económico.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito que el requiere es para un capital que necesita para la compra de mas materiales de construcción para su respectiva venta e distribución de su materia prima por toda su comunidad.

Una de las metas de Felix es obtener ganancias para poder comprar un camión para el transporte de los materiales que el pone a disposición de su comunidad y brindar estudios a sus hijos para que ellos sean profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Felix is from Sololá, is 36 years old, and has four children, who are 7, 6, and 3 years old, and 3 months old. He works hard to support his family and meet their needs.

Felix primarily works buying and selling construction materials, to make an income to sustain his family. He learned this work through his brother, who he worked with for four years before starting his own business to earn a higher income. He has been running this business for over 10 years, and it is a good source of income. 

Felix will use the loan to buy more construction materials for his sales and distributions of the raw material throughout the community. 

One of his goals is to obtain enough profit to buy a truck to transport the materials to the community, and to provide his children with an education so that they can become working professionals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Savoeung's Group

texts.en: Savoeung’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Savoeung makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as construction worker and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sovanith

texts.en:
Sovanith is a 21-year-old Customer Service Officer in a Microfinance Institution and a student living with her parents in the Siem reap Province of Cambodia. 

Before she started working, she helped her parents with farming. Being a Customer Service Officer, Sovanith can earn approximately $5 daily. Because of a lack of financial support, she would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fee. This loan will help her graduate. 

In the future, she wants to have her own business and her own house.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Samath

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Chhnang province, Samath is 44 years old. She is a mother of two children, one is in school and one is too young. 

She earns a living via rice cropping as her main source of income and pig-raising to supplement her income. She has been involved in her business for 18 years and it earns her about 9.72 USD per day. This is not her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her house will have electricity to use.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Koeun's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Speu province, Koeun is 50 years old and a mother of two children; one of whom is in school. She struggles with her family's living conditions via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day. 

For Koeun, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family will have clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es:
José un muy simpático hombre de 55 años de edad que aún disfruta su soltería y que encontró en la soldadura automotriz su mayor pasión, aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, viendo y trabajando como ayudante.
Hoy por hoy es un experimentado soldador al cual varias personas acuden confiándoles su vehículo. 

El señor José quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de un Taladro de barrena que lo necesita con urgencia.
Jose es un hombre soltero que depende de este negocio para comer, para transportarse y pro que no para tomarse una copita con sus amigos. 

No cotiza con el seguro y en su vejez que ya está próxima necesita de un negocio que le ayude a tener una vida tranquila y confiado de que en un futuro no pasara necesidades por eso apoyémoslo en este proyecto.
texts.en:
José, 55, is a friendly man who still enjoys being single. He found his passion in automotive metal work, something he learned by watching others while he worked as an assistant. He is now an experienced welder and many clients trust him with their cars.

José is requesting a loan to buy a bench drill; he needs it urgently.

José is a single man who depends on this business to eat, transport himself and why not, to have some drinks with his friends. He is now reaching an advanced age and is not registered to any pension fund. He needs to have a job that helps him to live a good life and trusts that in the future he will not have difficulties. This is why he needs support for this project.

loans.use: to buy a bench drill.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 42 years old and single with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She practices farming and owns a veterinary chemical shop. She grows crops such as beans tomatoes, rice, cotton, maize, and many others. She has been in that business for three years. She began the business to generate income. She is hard-working and has a dream of building a residential house, however lack of enough capital is a challenge. 

Annet wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 42, is a mother of six children living in Kampong Speu province. Nowadays, she works for others for a fee as her main source of income. She can earn additional income via rice cropping. Mom can earn an income of about 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan cycle for Mom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter to support her living. 

She hopes that her house will have clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 34-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of three children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. Her husband has been running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Shahida wants to grow the business of her husband, so she has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan so he can buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan; she is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in earnings, and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. 

She is very thankful to Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's store
